sourceString: As of 28 March, there were 32,308 confirmed cases in New York City, and 672 people had died from the virus.On 26 March, the United States was reported to have more confirmed coronavirus infection cases than any other country in the world, including China and Italy.As of 8 April, 400,335 cases have been confirmed in the United States, and 12,841 people have died.
targetString: د مارچ په 28مه، په نیویارک ښار کې 32،308 تایید شوې قضیې شتون درلود ، او 672 کسان د ویروس څخه مړه شوي وو. د مارچ په 26 ، متحده ایالاتو د چین په شمول د نړۍ د کوم بل هیواد په پرتله د کورونا ویروس ډیر تصدیق شوې پیښې درلودې. او ایټالیا. د اپریل د 8 نیټې راهیسې ، په متحده ایالاتو کې 400،335 قضیې تایید شوي ، او 12،841 کسان مړه شوي دي.
en-mt: As of March 28, there were 32,308 confirmed cases in New York City, and 672 people had died from the virus. As of March 26, the United States had more confirmed cases of the coronavirus than any other country in the world, including China. and Italy. As of April 8, 400,335 cases have been confirmed in the United States, and 12,841 people have died.

sourceString: Per media reports on 30 March, U.S. President Trump has decided to extend social distancing guidelines until 30 April.
targetString: د میډیا راپورونو پر 30 د مارچ په 30 ، د متحده ایالاتو ولسمشر ټرمپ پریکړه کړې چې د ټولنیز واټن لارښودونه د اپریل تر 30 پورې وغځوي.
en-mt: According to media reports on March 30, US President Trump has decided to extend social distancing guidelines until April 30.

sourceString: On the same day, the USNS Comfort, a hospital ship with about 1000 beds, made anchor in New York.
targetString: په ورته ورځ ، د USNS آرامۍ ، د 1000 کټونو سره د روغتون کښتۍ ، په نیویارک کې لنگر جوړ کړ.
en-mt: That same day, the USNS Comfort, a hospital ship with 1,000 kits, anchored in New York.

sourceString: On 3 April, the U.S. had a record 884 deaths due to the coronavirus in a 24-hour period.
targetString: د اپریل په 3مه، متحده ایالاتو د 24 ساعتونو په موده کې د کورونویرس له امله 884 مړینې درلودې.
en-mt: On April 3, the United States had 884 deaths from the coronavirus in a 24-hour period.

sourceString: In the state of New York the cases have exceeded 100,000 people on 3 April.The White House has been criticized for downplaying the threat and controlling the messaging by directing health officials and scientists to coordinate public statements and publications related to the virus with the office of Vice-President Mike Pence.
targetString: د نیویارک په ایالت کې قضیې د اپریل په 3 د 100،000 خلکو څخه ډیر شوي. د سپینې ما ڼۍ لخوا د ګواښ کمولو او پیغام رسولو کنټرول لپاره د روغتیا چارواکو او ساینس پوهانو ته لارښوونه شوې ترڅو د ویروس اړوند عامه اعالمیې او خپرونې همغږي کړي. د ولسمشر مرستیال مایک پینس.
en-mt: Cases in New York state surpassed 100,000 on April 3. The White House has directed health officials and scientists to coordinate public announcements and publications related to the virus to reduce the threat and control messaging. Vice President Mike Pence.

sourceString: Overall approval of Trump's management of the crisis has been polarized along partisan lines.
targetString: د ټرمپ د کړکیچ مدیریت په عمومي ډول تصویب د اړخونو په اوږدو کې قطبی شوی دی.
en-mt: Overall approval of Trump's crisis management has been polarized along party lines.

sourceString: Some U.S. officials and commentators criticized the U.S. reliance on importation of critical materials, including essential medical supplies, from China.
targetString: د متحده ایالاتو ځینې چارواکو او نظارت کونکو له چین څخه د لازمي طبي توکو په ګډون د انتقادي موادو واردولو باندې د متحده ایالاتو پر اتکا نیوکه وکړه.
en-mt: Some US officials and watchdogs have criticized the US's reliance on imports of critical materials, including essential medical supplies, from China.

sourceString: An analysis of air travel patterns was used to map and predict patterns of spread and was published in The Journal of Travel Medicine in mid-January 2020.
targetString: د هوایی سفر نمونو تحلیل د خپریدو نمونې نقشه او وړاندوینې لپاره وکارول شوې او د جنوري په نیمایي کې د سفر طب په ژورنال کې خپره شوه.
en-mt: Analysis of air travel patterns was used to map and predict spread patterns and was published in the Journal of Travel Medicine in mid-January.

sourceString: Based on 2018 information from the International Air Transport Association, Bangkok, Hong Kong, Tokyo, and Taipei had the largest volume of travellers from Wuhan.
targetString: د نړیوال هوایی ترانسپورت اتحادیې څخه د 2018 معلوماتو پراساس، بنکاک، هانګ کانګ ، ټوکیو، او تایپي له وانهان څخه د مسافرینو ترټولو لوی مقدار درلود.
en-mt: Based on 2018 data from the International Air Transport Association, Bangkok, Hong Kong, Tokyo, and Taipei had the highest passenger volumes from Wuhan.

sourceString: Dubai, Sydney, and Melbourne were also reported as popular destinations for people travelling from Wuhan.
targetString: دوبۍ ، سیډني او میلبورن هم د هغو خلکو لپاره د مشهور ځایونو په توګه راپور شوي چې له وانهان څخه سفر کوي.
en-mt: Dubai, Sydney and Melbourne are also reported as popular destinations for people traveling from Wanhan.

sourceString: Bali was reported as least able among the 20 most popular destination cities in terms of preparedness, while cities in Australia were considered most able.Australia released its Emergency Response Plan for Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) on 7 February.
targetString: بالي د چمتووالي شرایطو کې د 20 ترټولو مشهور منزل ښارونو کې لږ لږ وړ راپور شوی و. پداسې حال کې چې په آسټرالیا کې ښارونه ترټولو وړ وګنړل شول. آسټرالیا د فبروري په 7 مه د ناول کورونویرس (COVID-19) لپاره د خپل بیړني غبرګون پلان خپور کړ.
en-mt: Bali was reported to be the least qualified of the 20 most popular destination cities in terms of preparedness. While cities in Australia were rated the most eligible. Australia released its emergency response plan for the novel coronavirus (COVID-19) on February 7.

sourceString: It stated that much was yet to be discovered about COVID-19, and that Australia would emphasize border control and communication in its response to the pandemic.
targetString: دې ویلي چې د COVID-19 په اړه لاهم کشف شوی نه دی ، او دا چې آسټرالیا به د وبا په وړاندې غبرګون کې د پولې کنټرول او مواصلاتو باندې تاکید وکړي.
en-mt: It said that there was still no detection of COVID-19, and that Australia would emphasize border control and communications in its response to the outbreak.

sourceString: On 21 March, a human biosecurity emergency was declared in Australia.
targetString: د مارچ په 21مه، په آسټرالیا کې د انساني بایوسیکوریت اضطراري حالت اعلان شو.
en-mt: On March 21, a human biosecurity emergency was declared in Australia.

sourceString: Owing to the effective quarantine of public transport in Wuhan and Hubei, several countries have planned to evacuate their citizens and diplomatic staff from the area, primarily through chartered flights of the home nation, with Chinese authorities providing clearance.
targetString: په ووهان او هوبي کې د عامه ترانسپورت مؤثره قانوني کیدو له امله ، څو هیوادونو پلان درلود چې خپل وګړي او ډیپلوماټیک کارمندان له سیمې څخه وباسي ، په ځانګړي توګه د کور د کرایه الوتنو له لارې ، چینايي چارواکو د دې تصفیه کولو سره.
en-mt: Due to the effective legalization of public transportation in Wuhan and Hubei, several countries planned to evacuate their citizens and diplomatic staff from the region, particularly via chartered flights home, with Chinese officials clearing this.

sourceString: Canada, the United States, Japan, India, Sri Lanka, Australia, France, Argentina, Germany, and Thailand were among the first to plan the evacuation of their citizens.
targetString: کاناډا، متحده ایالات، جاپان، هندوستان، سریلانکا، آسټرالیا، فرانسه، ارجنټاین، جرمني او تایلینډ د لومړیو هیوادونو څخه و چې د خپلو اتباعو ایستلو پلان یې درلود.
en-mt: Canada, the United States, Japan, India, Sri Lanka, Australia, France, Argentina, Germany and Thailand were among the first countries to plan to evacuate their citizens.

sourceString: Pakistan has said that it will not be evacuating any citizens from China.
targetString: پاکستان ویلي دي چې له چین څخه به هیڅ اتباع ونه باسي.
en-mt: Pakistan has said that it will not deport any citizen from China.

sourceString: On 7 February, Brazil evacuated 34 Brazilians or family members in addition to four Poles, a Chinese person, and an Indian citizen.
targetString: د فبروري په 7مه، برازیل د څلور قطبونو سربیره 34 برازیلیان یا د کورنۍ غړي ایستل شوي، یو چینایي کس او یو هندي تبعه.
en-mt: On February 7, Brazil deported 34 Brazilians or family members, one Chinese and one Indian national, in addition to the four Poles.

sourceString: The citizens of Poland, China, and India deplaned in Poland, where the Brazilian plane made a stopover before following its route to Brazil.
targetString: د پولینډ، چین او هندوستان اتباع په پولینډ کې ځای په ځای شوي ، چیرې چې برازیلي الوتکې برازیل ته د رسیدو دمخه د تګ مخه ونیوله.
en-mt: Citizens of Poland, China and India were accommodated in Poland, where the Brazilian plane was stopped before reaching Brazil.

sourceString: Brazilian citizens who went to Wuhan were quarantined at a military base near Brasília.
targetString: د برازیل اتباع چې ووهان ته تللي د برازیلیا سره نږدې په نظامي اډه کې ساتل شوي وو.
en-mt: Brazilian nationals who went to Wuhan were held at a military base near Brasilia.

sourceString: On the same day, 215 Canadians (176 from the first plane, and 39 from a second plane chartered by the U.S. government) were evacuated from Wuhan to CFB Trenton to be quarantined for two weeks.
targetString: په ورته ورځ ، 215 کاناډایان (د لومړي الوتکې څخه 176 ، او 39 د دویمې الوتکې څخه چې د متحده ایالاتو حکومت لخوا په کرایه شوي وو) له ووهان څخه CFB ټرینټن ته وړل شوي ترڅو د دوه اونیو لپاره قید پاتې شي.
en-mt: On the same day, 215 Canadians (176 from the first plane, and 39 from the second plane chartered by the US government) were flown from Wuhan to CFB Trenton to be held for two weeks.

sourceString: On 11 February, another plane of 185 Canadians from Wuhan landed at CFB Trenton.
targetString: د فبرورۍ په 11مه، له وانهان څخه د  185 کاناډایانو یوه بله الوتکه د CFB ټرنټن ته راغله.
en-mt: On February 11, another flight of 185 Canadians from Wanhan arrived at CFB Trenton.

sourceString: Australian authorities evacuated 277 citizens on 3 and 4 February to the Christmas Island Detention Centre, which had been repurposed as a quarantine facility, where they remained for 14 days.
targetString: د آسټرالیا چارواکو 277 اتباع د فبروري په 3 او 4 د کرسمس ټاپو توقیف ځای ته انتقال کړل ، کوم چې د قرنطین تاسیس په توګه له سره ځای په ځای شوی و ، چیرې چې دوی د 14 ورځو لپاره پاتې وو.
en-mt: Australian authorities transferred the 277 nationals on February 3 and 4 to the Christmas Island detention facility, which had been repurposed as a quarantine facility, where they remained for 14 days.

sourceString: A New Zealand evacuation flight arrived in Auckland on 5 February; its passengers (including some from Australia and the Pacific) were quarantined at a naval base in Whangaparoa, north of Auckland.
targetString: د نیوزیلینډ د وتلو الوتکه د فبروري په 5 په آکلینډ کې ورسیده؛ د دې مسافر (په شمول ځینې د آسټرلیا او بحرالکاہل دي) د آکلینډ په شمال ، وانګاپاروو کې د بحري ځواکونو په اډه کې قرنطین شوي وو.
en-mt: The flight departing New Zealand arrived in Auckland on 5 February; Its passengers (including some from Australia and the Pacific) were quarantined at a naval base in Whangaparoo, north of Auckland.

sourceString: On 15 February, the United States announced that it would evacuate Americans aboard the cruise ship Diamond Princess.
targetString: د فبروري په 15، متحده ایالاتو اعلان وکړ چې دوی به د کروز کښتۍ هیرمین شهزاده کې سپاره امریکایان وباسي.
en-mt: On February 15, the United States announced that it would evacuate the Americans aboard the Hermine Princess cruise ship.

sourceString: On 21 February, a plane carrying 129 Canadian passengers who had been evacuated from Diamond Princess landed in Trenton, Ontario.
targetString: د فبروري په 21 ، یوه الوتکه چې د 129 کاناډایی مسافرینو لرونکې وه چې د ڈائمنډ شهزادګۍ څخه ایستل شوې وه په اونټاریو کې په ټرینټن کې راښکته شوله.
en-mt: On February 21, a plane carrying 129 Canadian passengers who had been evacuated from the Diamond Princess landed in Trenton, Ontario.

sourceString: In early March, the Indian government began evacuating its citizens from Iran.On 14 March a South African Airways aircraft chartered by the South African Government repatriated 112 South African citizens.
targetString: د مارچ په پیل کې، د هند حکومت د ایران څخه د اتباعو ایستل پیل کړل. د مارچ په 14 د جنوبي افریقا د هوایی شرکت الوتکې د سویلي افریقا حکومت لخوا په کرایه شوې د 112 جنوبي افریقا اتباع بیرته راستون کړل.
en-mt: In early March, the Indian government began evacuating citizens from Iran. On March 14, a South African Airways plane chartered by the South African government returned 112 South African citizens.

sourceString: Medical screening was performed prior to departure, and four South Africans who were showing signs of coronavirus were left behind to mitigate risk.
targetString: د طبي پلټنې د وتلو دمخه ترسره شوې ، او څلور جنوبي افریقایان چې د کورونویرس نښې ښیې ، د خطر کمولو لپاره پاتې شوي.
en-mt: Medical checks were carried out before departure, and four South Africans who showed symptoms of the coronavirus, stayed to reduce the risk.

sourceString: Only South Africans who tested negative were repatriated.
targetString: یوازې جنوبي افریقایان چې منفي ازمول شوي بیرته راستانه شوي.
en-mt: Only South Africans who tested negative were returned.

sourceString: Test results cleared all the South Africans, including the flight crew, pilots, hotel staff, police and soldiers involved in the humanitarian mission who, as a precautionary measure, all remained under observation and in quarantine for a 14-day period at The Ranch Resort.
targetString: د ازموینې پایلې ټول سویلي افریقیان پاک کړل ، پشمول د الوتکې عمله ، پیلوټان ، د هوټل کارمندان ، پولیس او د بشري ماموریت کې شامل سرتیري چې د احتیاطي اقداماتو په توګه ، ټول د 14 ورځو لپاره په رینچ ریزورټ کې تر نظارت لاندې ساتل کیږي.
en-mt: The test results cleared all South Africans, including flight crew, pilots, hotel staff, police and soldiers involved in humanitarian missions, who, as a precautionary measure, are all being kept under observation at a ranch resort for 14 days.

sourceString: On 20 March, the United States began to partially withdrawal its troops from Iraq due to the pandemic.
targetString: د مارچ په 20مه، متحده ایالاتو د وبا د ناروغۍ له امله له عراق څخه خپل سرتیري په جزوي توګه ایستل پیل کړل.
en-mt: On March 20, the United States began a partial withdrawal of troops from Iraq due to the pandemic.

sourceString: On 5 February, the Chinese foreign ministry stated that 21 countries (including Belarus, Pakistan, Trinidad and Tobago, Egypt, and Iran) had sent aid to China.
targetString: د فبروري په 5مه، د چین د بهرنیو چارو وزارت وویل چې 21 هیوادونو (د بیلاروس ، پاکستان ، ټرینیډاډ او ټوباګو ، مصر او ایران په ګډون) چین ته مرستې لیږلي دي.
en-mt: On February 5th, the Chinese Foreign Ministry said that 21 countries (including Belarus, Pakistan, Trinidad and Tobago, Egypt and Iran) had sent aid to China.

sourceString: Some Chinese students at American universities joined together to help send aid to virus-stricken parts of China, with a joint group in the greater Chicago area reportedly managing to send 50,000 N95 masks to hospitals in the Hubei province on 30 January.The humanitarian aid organization Direct Relief, in coordination with FedEx, sent 200,000 face masks along with other personal protective equipment, including gloves and gowns, by emergency airlift to the Wuhan Union Hospital by 30 January.
targetString: په امریکایی پوهنتونونو کې ځینې چینایی زده کونکي د شیکاګو په لویه سیمه کې د چین د ویروس ځپلو سیمو ته د مرستې لیږلو کې د مرستې لپاره سره یوځای شوي ، د راپور له مخې د جنوري په 30مه د هوبي ولایت روغتونونو ته 50،000 N95 ماسک لیږلي. د بشري مرستو سازمان مستقیم امدادي ، د فیډ ایکسکس سره په همغږۍ کې ، د جنوري تر 30 پورې د بېړنۍ الوتنې له لارې د 200،000 مخ ماسکونه د نورو شخصي محافظتي تجهیزاتو سره ، د دستکشې او ګاون په ګډون ، د واهان یونین روغتون ته د بیړنۍ الوتنې له لارې واستول.
en-mt: Some Chinese students at American universities have banded together to help send aid to virus-hit areas of China in the greater Chicago area, reportedly sending 50,000 N95 masks to hospitals in Hubei province on January 30. sent The humanitarian aid organization Direct Aid, in coordination with FEDEX, has by January 30 airlifted 200,000 face masks along with other personal protective equipment, including gloves and gowns, to Wuhan Union Hospital. Shipping by express flight.

sourceString: On 5 February, Bill and Melinda Gates announced a $100 million donation to the WHO to fund vaccine research and treatment efforts along with protecting "at-risk populations in Africa and South Asia".
targetString: د فبرورۍ په 5مه، بل او میلندا ګیټس د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان ته د "په افریقا او سویلي آسیا کې د خطر خطر لرونکو وګړو" د ساتنې ترڅنګ د واکسین د تحقیق او درملنې هڅو تمویل لپاره د $ 100 ملیون ډالرو مرسته اعلان کړه.
en-mt: On February 5, Bill and Melinda Gates announced a $100 million donation to the World Health Organization to fund vaccine research and treatment efforts while protecting "at-risk populations in Africa and South Asia."

sourceString: Interaksyon reported that the Chinese government donated 200,000 masks to the Philippines on 6 February, after Senator Richard Gordon shipped 3.16 million masks to Wuhan.
targetString: انټرکسیان راپور ورکړ چې د چین حکومت د فبرورۍ په 6مه د فیلیپین سره 200،000 ماسکونه مرسته وکړه، وروسته له هغه چې سناتور ریچارډ ګورډن ووهان ته 3.16 ملیون ماسکونه واستول.
en-mt: Interxian reported that the Chinese government donated 200,000 masks to the Philippines on February 6, after Senator Richard Gordon sent 3.16 million masks to Wuhan.

sourceString: On 19 February, the Singapore Red Cross announced that it would send $2.26 million worth of aid to China.
targetString: د فبرورۍ په 19مه، د سینګاپور سرې میاشتې اعلان وکړ چې چین ته به د 2.26 ملیون ډالرو په ارزښت مرستې لیږي.
en-mt: On February 19, Singapore's Red Crescent announced that it would send $2.26 million worth of aid to China.

sourceString: Japan donated one million face masks to Wuhan, Turkey dispatched medical equipment, Russia sent more than 13 tonnes of medical supplies to Wuhan, Malaysia announced a donation of 18 million medical gloves to China, Germany delivered various medical supplies including 10,000 Hazmat suits, and the United States donated 17.8 tons of medical supplies to China and promised an additional $100 million in financial support to affected countries.After cases in China seemed to stabilize, the country has been sending aid to various nations hit by the pandemic.
targetString: جاپان ووهان ته  یو ملیون ماسکونه ډالۍ کړل، ترکیې طبي وسایل ولېږدول، روسیې ته له  13 ټنو څخه ډیر طبي سامان ولیان ته ولیږل، مالیزیا چین ته د  ملیونه طبي دستانو مرسته اعلان کړه ، جرمني د 10،000 هزامت سوټونو په ګډون بیلابیل طبي سامانونه ورسول ، او متحده ایالاتو چین ته 8 .17 ټنه طبي مرسته وکړه او اغیزمنو هیوادونو ته د ملیونه ډالرو اضافي مالي مرستې ژمنه وکړه. وروسته له هغه چې په چین کې پیښې ثبات بریښي ، دغه هیواد بیلابیلو هیوادونو ته د مرض له امله زیان رسیدونکی مرستې لیږي.
en-mt: Japan donated one million masks to Wuhan, Turkey sent medical equipment, Russia sent more than 13 tons of medical supplies to Wuhan, Malaysia announced a donation of millions of medical gloves to China, Germany donated various medical supplies including 10,000 hazmat suits. , and the United States donated 8.17 tons of medical aid to China and pledged millions of dollars in additional financial aid to affected countries. After the situation in China seems to stabilize, the country sends aid to various countries affected by the disease.

sourceString: In March, China, Cuba and Russia sent medical supplies and experts to help Italy deal with its coronavirus outbreak.
targetString: په مارچ کې ، چین، کیوبا او روسیه طبي اکمالات او کارپوهان لیږلي ترڅو د ایټالیا سره د هغه د کورونا ویروس ناروغي اخته کیدو کې مرسته وکړي.
en-mt: In March, China, Cuba and Russia sent medical supplies and experts to help Italy deal with its coronavirus outbreak.

sourceString: Businessman Jack Ma sent 1.1 million testing kits, 6 million face masks, and 60,000 protective suits to Addis Ababa, Ethiopia for distribution by the African Union.
targetString: سوداګر جیک ما د افریقایي اتحادیې لخوا توزیع لپاره ایتوپیا ، اډیس ابابا ته 1.1 ملیون ټیسټ کټونه ، 6 ملیون  ماسکونه، او 60،000 محافظتي طبي چپنې لیږلې دي.
en-mt: Businessman Jack Ma has sent 1.1 million test kits, 6 million masks, and 60,000 protective medical pads to Addis Ababa, Ethiopia for distribution by the African Union.

sourceString: He later sent 5,000 testing kits, 100,000 face masks and 5 ventilators to Panama.
targetString: له هغه وروسته پاناما ته د ازموینې 5000 کټونه، 100،000 د مخ ماسکونه او 5 وینټیلیټر لیږلي.
en-mt: It has since sent 5,000 test kits, 100,000 face masks and 5 ventilators to Panama.

sourceString: Ma also donated medical supplies to Canada.The Netherlands, Spain, Turkey, Georgia, and the Czech Republic expressed their concerns over Chinese-made masks and test kits.
targetString: ما کاناډا ته طبي مرستې هم ورکړې. هالنډ، هسپانیه، ترکیه، جورجیا، او چک جمهوریت د چینایي ماسکونو او ټیسټ کټونو په اړه اندیښنه څرګنده کړه.
en-mt: I also gave medical aid to Canada. The Netherlands, Spain, Turkey, Georgia, and the Czech Republic have expressed concern about Chinese masks and test kits.

sourceString: For instance, Spain withdrew 58,000 Chinese-made coronavirus testing kits with an accuracy rate of just 30%, meanwhile, the Netherlands recalled 600,000 Chinese face masks which were defective.
targetString: د مثال په توګه، هسپانیا د 30،000 چینایي جوړ شوي کورونویرس ټیسټ کټونه بیرته واستول چې دقیقیت یې یوازې 30٪ دی ، په عین وخت کې ، هالینډ 600,000 چینايي مخ ماسکونه بیرته ستنیدل کړل کوم چې عیب و.
en-mt: For example, Spain sent back 30,000 Chinese-made coronavirus test kits that were only 30% accurate, while Holland sent back 600,000 Chinese face masks that were defective.

sourceString: Belgium recalled 100,000 unusable masks, thought to be from China, but were in fact from Colombia.
targetString: بلجیم 100،000 ناقابل کار ماسکونه یاد کړل، فکر یې د چین څخه و ، مګر واقعیا د کولمبیا څخه و.
en-mt: Belgium recalled 100,000 unusable masks, thought to be from China, but actually from Colombia.

sourceString: On the other hand, Chinese aid has been well-received in parts of Latin America and Africa.On 2 April, the World Bank launched emergency support operations for developing countries.
targetString: له بلې خوا، د چین مرستې د لاتین امریکا او افریقا په برخو کې ښه ترلاسه شوي. د اپریل په 2مه، نړیوال بانک د مخ پر ودې هیوادونو لپاره د بیړني ملاتړ عملیات پیل کړل.
en-mt: On the other hand, Chinese aid has been well received in parts of Latin America and Africa. On April 2, the World Bank launched an emergency support operation for developing countries.

sourceString: The WHO has commended the efforts of Chinese authorities in managing and containing the epidemic.
targetString: د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان د وبا په اداره کولو او ساتلو کې د چینايي چارواکو هڅې وستایلې.
en-mt: The World Health Organization praised the efforts of the Chinese authorities in managing and containing the epidemic.

sourceString: The WHO noted the contrast between the 2002–2004 SARS outbreak, where Chinese authorities were accused of secrecy that impeded prevention and containment efforts, and the current crisis where the central government "has provided regular updates to avoid panic ahead of Lunar New Year holidays".
targetString: د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان د 2002–2004 SARS خپریدو ترمینځ توپیر په ګوته کړ ، چیرې چې چینايي چارواکي په محرمیت تورن شوي چې د مخنیوي د هڅو مخه نیسي ، او اوسني بحران چیرې چې مرکزي حکومت "د نوي کال رخصتیو دمخه د ویره مخنیوي لپاره منظم تازه معلومات چمتو کړي"
en-mt: The World Health Organization has highlighted the contrast between the 2002–2004 SARS outbreak, where Chinese officials were accused of secrecy that hampered prevention efforts, and the current crisis where the central government "regularly took measures to prevent panic before the New Year holidays." provide updates"

sourceString: On 23 January, in reaction to the central authorities' decision to implement a transportation ban in Wuhan, WHO representative Gauden Galea remarked that while it was "certainly not a recommendation the WHO has made", it was also "a very important indication of the commitment to contain the epidemic in the place where it is most concentrated" and called it "unprecedented in public health history".On 30 January, following confirmation of human-to-human transmission outside China and the increase in the number of cases in other countries, the WHO declared the outbreak a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC), the sixth PHEIC since the measure was first invoked during the 2009 swine flu pandemic.
targetString: د جنورۍ په 23مه، د مرکزي چارواکو پریکړه باندې په ووهان کې د ترانسپورت بندیز پلي کولو په عکس العمل کې، د نړیوال سازمان استازی ګاډین ګالیا څرګنده کړه چې پداسې حال کې چې دا "یقینا د روغتیا د نړیوال سازمان لخوا وړاندیز شوی نه و" ، دا هم "د دې ترټولو مهمه نښه وه. ژمنتیا په هغه ځای کې د ناروغۍ مخه ونیسي چیرې چې دا خورا متمرکز دی او دا یې د "د عامې روغتیا په تاریخ کې بې ساری" بللی.د جنورۍ په 30مه، له چین څخه بهر له انسان نه انسان ته لیږد تصدیق او په نورو هیوادونو کې د قضیو شمیر ډیروالي وروسته، د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان راپور ورکړ چې د نړیوال اندیښنې عامه روغتیا اضطراري حالت (PHEIC) و ، دا اقدام شپږم پی ایچ ای ای دی. لومړی د 2009 د سوین فلو ناروغي پرمهال غوښتنه وشوه.
en-mt: On January 23, reacting to the central authorities' decision to impose a travel ban in Wuhan, WHO representative Gadin Gallia explained that while it was "certainly not recommended by the World Health Organization," , it was also "the most important sign of its commitment to stop the disease where it is most concentrated and called it "unprecedented in the history of public health". January 30, from China After confirmation of human-to-human transmission abroad and an increase in the number of cases in other countries, the World Health Organization declared it a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC), the sixth PHEIC action. The first was in 2009. Requested during swine flu outbreak.

sourceString: WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom said that the PHEIC was due to "the risk of global spread, especially to low- and middle-income countries without robust health systems.
targetString: د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان عمومي مدیر ټیډروس اډانوم وویل چې PHEIC د نړیوال خپریدو خطر له امله و ، په ځانګړي توګه ټیټ او متوسط عاید لرونکو هیوادونو کې چې قوي صحي سیسټمونه نلري.
en-mt: WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom said that PHEIC was at risk of global spread, particularly in low- and middle-income countries without strong health systems.

sourceString: In response to the implementations of travel restrictions, Tedros stated that "there is no reason for measures that unnecessarily interfere with international travel and trade" and that the "WHO doesn't recommend limiting trade and movement."
targetString: د سفر محدودیتونو پلي کولو په ځواب کې ، ټیډروس وویل چې "د داسې اقداماتو لپاره هیڅ دلیل شتون نلري چې غیر ضروري په نړیوال سفر او تجارت کې مداخله وکړي" او دا چې "د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان د سوداګرۍ او خوځښت محدودولو وړاندیز نه کوي."
en-mt: In response to the imposition of travel restrictions, Tedros said that "there is no reason for measures that unnecessarily interfere with international travel and trade" and that "the World Health Organization does not recommend restricting trade and movement. "

sourceString: On 5 February, the WHO appealed to the global community for a $675 million contribution to fund strategic preparedness in low-income countries, citing the urgency to support those countries which "do not have the systems in place to detect people who have contracted the virus, even if it were to emerge".
targetString: د فبروري په 5مه، د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان نړیوالې ټولنې څخه د کم عاید لرونکي هیوادونو کې د ستراتیژیک چمتووالي تمویل لپاره د 675 ملیون ډالرو مرستې لپاره غوښتنه وکړه، او د هغه هیوادونو ملاتړ کولو ته بیړني حالت یې په ګوته کړ چې "داسې سیسټمونه نلري چې د خلکو پیژندنه وکړي کوم چې د ویروس باندې اخته شوي. "حتی که دا څرګند هم وی".
en-mt: On February 5, the World Health Organization appealed to the international community for $675 million to fund strategic preparedness in low-income countries, citing an urgent need to support countries that "do not have such systems in place." to identify people who have been infected with the virus "even if it's obvious".

sourceString: Tedros further made statements declaring that "we are only as strong as our weakest link" and urged the international community to "invest today or pay more later".On 11 February, the WHO in a press conference established COVID-19 as the name of the disease.
targetString: ټیډروس پدې اړه نور بیانونه هم خپاره کړل چې "موږ یوازې زموږ د ضعیف اړیکې په څیر پیاوړي یو" او له نړیوالې ټولنې یې وغوښتل چې "نن ورځ پانګونه وکړي یا ډیر وروسته پیسې ورکړي".د فبرورۍ په 11مه، د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان په یوه مطبوعاتي کنفرانس کې COVID-19 د ناروغۍ نوم په توګه تاسیس کړ.
en-mt: Tedros also issued further statements that "we are only as strong as our weakest link" and urged the international community to "invest today or pay much later". On February 11, the World Health Organization A press conference established COVID-19 as the name of the disease.

sourceString: On the same day, Tedros stated that UN Secretary-General António Guterres had agreed to provide the "power of the entire UN system in the response".
targetString: په ورته ورځ، ټیډروس وویل چې د ملګرو ملتونو عمومي منشي انتونیو ګوټریس موافقه کړې چې "په ځواب کې د ملګرو ملتونو د ټول سیستم ځواک" چمتو کړي.
en-mt: On the same day, Tedros said that UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres had agreed to provide "the strength of the entire UN system in response".

sourceString: A UN Crisis Management Team was activated as a result, allowing coordination of the entire United Nations response, which the WHO states will allow them to "focus on the health response while the other agencies can bring their expertise to bear on the wider social, economic and developmental implications of the outbreak".
targetString: د ملګرو ملتونو د کړکیچ د مدیریت ډله د پایلې په توګه فعاله شوې، او د ملګرو ملتونو د ټول غبرګون همغږي کولو ته اجازه ورکوي ، کوم چې د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان به دوی ته اجازه ورکړي "روغتیا ځواب باندې متمرکز کړي پداسې حال کې چې نورې ادارې کولی شي خپلې تجربې پراخه ټولنیز ، اقتصادي باندې راوړي. او د خپریدو پرمختیایی اثرونه ".
en-mt: The United Nations Crisis Management Group has been activated as a result, and will allow for the coordination of the entire UN response, which the World Health Organization will allow them to "focus on the health response while other Institutions can bring their experiences on the wider social, economic and development impacts of diffusion".

sourceString: On 14 February, a WHO-led Joint Mission Team with China was activated to provide international and WHO experts on the ground in China to assist in the domestic management and evaluate "the severity and the transmissibility of the disease" by hosting workshops and meetings with key national-level institutions and to conduct field visits to assess the "impact of response activities at provincial and county levels, including urban and rural settings".On 25 February, the WHO declared that "the world should do more to prepare for a possible coronavirus pandemic," stating that while it was still too early to call it a pandemic, countries should nonetheless be "in a phase of preparedness".
targetString: د فبرورۍ په 14مه، د چین سره د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان په مشرۍ د ګډ ماموریت ټیم فعال شو ترڅو په نړۍ کې د نړیوال او روغتیا نړیوال سازمان متخصصین چمتو کړي ترڅو په کورني مدیریت کې مرسته وکړي او د ورکشاپونو او ناستو کوربه توب سره "د ناروغۍ شدت او لیږد وړتیا" ارزونه وکړي. د ملي کچې مهمې ادارې او د ساحې لیدنې ترسره کول ترڅو "د ولایتي او هیواد په کچه د غبرګون فعالیتونو اغیزو ارزونه وکړي ، پشمول د ښاري او کلیوالي تنظیماتو".د فبرورۍ په 25مه، د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان اعلان وکړ چې "نړۍ باید د احتمالي کورون ویروس ناروغي لپاره چمتووالی لپاره ډیر څه وکړي ،" په ګوته کړه پداسې حال کې چې لاهم لا دمخه د دې ناروغۍ پیژندل ډیر ژر و ، هیوادونه باید "د چمتووالي مرحلې" کې وي.
en-mt: On February 14th, a WHO-led joint mission team with China was activated to provide international and WHO experts worldwide to assist in domestic management and to host workshops and seminars on "the Assess disease severity and transmissibility. Conduct key national-level agency and field visits to "assess the impact of provincial and country-level response activities, including urban and rural settings." On February 25, the World Health Organization announced that "the world must "Do more to prepare for a possible coronavirus outbreak," pointing out that while it was still too early to identify the disease, countries should be in a "preparation phase."

sourceString: In response to a developing outbreak in Iran, the WHO sent a Joint Mission Team there to assess the situation.On 28 February, WHO officials said that the coronavirus threat assessment at the global level would be raised from "high" to "very high", its highest level of alert and risk assessment.
targetString: په ایران کې د ودې پدیدې په غبرګون کې ، د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان د وضعیت ارزولو لپاره هلته د ګډ ماموریت ډله ولیږله. د فبرورۍ په 28 ، د د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان چارواکو وویل چې په نړیواله کچه د کورونا ویروس خطر ارزونه به له "لوړې" څخه "خورا لوړه" ته پورته شي ، د خبرتیا او خطر ارزونې ترټولو عالي کچه.
en-mt: In response to the growing phenomenon in Iran, the World Health Organization sent a joint mission team there to assess the situation. On February 28, WHO officials said the global risk assessment of the coronavirus would be raised from "high" to "very high", the highest level of alert and risk assessment.

sourceString: Mike Ryan, executive director of the WHO's health emergencies program, warned in a statement that "This is a reality check for every government on the planet: Wake up.
targetString: مایک راین ، د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان  اضطراري برنامې اجرایوي رییس ، په یوه بیان کې خبرداری ورکړ چې "دا په سیارټ کې د هر حکومت لپاره د واقعیت چیک دی: راویښ شه.
en-mt: Mike Ryan, executive director of the World Health Organization's emergency program, warned in a statement that "this is a reality check for every government on the planet: wake up.

sourceString: This virus may be on its way and you need to be ready," urging that the right response measures could help the world avoid "the worst of it".
targetString: دا ویروس ممکن په خپل لاره وي او تاسو اړتیا لرئ چمتو اوسئ ، "ټینګار یې وکړ چې د سم غبرګون اقدامات ممکن نړۍ سره مرسته وکړي چې د" ترټولو ناوړه "څخه مخنیوی وکړي.
en-mt: This virus may be on its way and you need to be prepared,” stressing that proper response measures may help the world avoid “the worst”.

sourceString: Ryan further stated that the current data did not warrant public health officials to declare a global pandemic, saying that such a declaration would mean "we're essentially accepting that every human on the planet will be exposed to that virus."
targetString: رایان زیاته کړه چې اوسني ارقام د عامې روغتیا چارواکو ته ندی رسیدلی چې نړیواله ناروغي اعلان کړي ، او ویې ویل چې د دا ډول اعالمیې معنی دا ده "موږ په اساسي ډول دا منو چې په سیاره کې به هر انسان په ویروس اخته کیږي."
en-mt: Ryan added that the current figures are not enough for public health officials to declare a global pandemic, saying that such a declaration means "we basically accept that every human being on the planet will be infected with the virus."

sourceString: On 11 March, the WHO declared the coronavirus outbreak a pandemic.
targetString: د 2020 د مارچ په 11مه، د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان COVID-19 یوه عامه ساري ناروغی اعلان کړه.
en-mt: On March 11, 2020, the World Health Organization declared COVID-19 a public health emergency.

sourceString: The Director-General said that the WHO was "deeply concerned both by the alarming levels of spread and severity, and by the alarming levels of inaction".The WHO has faced significant criticism for what is seen as inadequate handling of the pandemic, including the late declaration of a public health emergency and the classification of the virus as a pandemic.
targetString: مونږ ډېر زيات د کورونه ناروغي په خطرناکه کچه خپرونې او شدت سره سره دا هغې خلاف ګامونه نه اخيستو په اړه ډېر زيات فکرمند يود روغتیا نړیوال سازمان د هغه څه لپاره د پام وړ نیوکې سره مخ شوی چې د ناروغۍ ناسمه اداره کول یې په ګوته کوي ، پشمول د عامې روغتیا اضطراب ناوخته اعالمیه او د ناروغۍ په توګه د ویروس طبقه بندي.
en-mt: We are very concerned about the alarming rate and severity of the outbreak, but not taking action against it. , including the late declaration of a public health emergency and the classification of the virus as an epidemic.

sourceString: The backlash included a petition for the WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom to tender his resignation, signed by 733,000 people as of 6 April.
targetString: په غبرګون کې د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان عمومي مدیر ټیډروس اډانوم ته د هغه استعفا ورکولو لپاره غوښتنلیک شامل و ، چې د اپریل تر 6 پورې د 733،000 خلکو لخوا لاسلیک شو.
en-mt: The response included a petition to WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus calling for his resignation, signed by 733,000 people as of April 6.

sourceString: On 26 March 2020, dozens of UN human rights experts emphasized respecting the rights of every individual during the COVID-19 pandemic.
targetString: د 2020 کال د مارچ په 26مه، د ملګرو ملتونو د بشري حقونو لسګونو متخصصینو د COVID-19 وبا پرمهال د هر فرد د حقونو درناوی ټینګار وکړ.
en-mt: On March 26, 2020, dozens of UN human rights experts emphasized respecting the rights of every individual during the COVID-19 pandemic.

sourceString: The expert group stated that everyone is entitled to life-saving interventions and the government holds this responsibility.
targetString: ماهر ډلې څرګنده کړه چې هرڅوک د ژوند ژغورنې مداخلو مستحق دي او حکومت دا مسؤلیت په غاړه لري.
en-mt: The expert group explained that everyone deserves life-saving interventions and that the government has this responsibility.

sourceString: The group stressed that the lack of resources or health insurance should never serve as a justification for discrimination against a specific group.
targetString: دې ډلې ټینګار وکړ چې د سرچینو نشتوالی یا روغتیا بیمه باید هیڅکله د یوې ځانګړې ډلې په وړاندې د تبعیض د جواز په توګه کار ونه کړي.
en-mt: The group emphasized that lack of resources or health insurance should never serve as a license to discriminate against a particular group.

sourceString: The experts underscored that every individual has the right to health, including people with disabilities, belonging to minority groups, older people, internally displaced people, the homeless, those living in extremely poor conditions, people in detention, as well as refugees and other unspecified groups in need of government support.
targetString: کارپوهانو ټینګار وکړ چې د معلولو کسانو په ګډون، د لږکیو ډلو پورې اړوند، زاړه خلک، داخلي بې ځایه شوي وګړي، بې کوره شوي، هغه کسان چې په خورا خراب حالت کې ژوند کوي او زندانیان د روغتیا حق لري او همدارنګه نور غیر مسلکي ډلې د دولت ملاتړ ته اړتیا لري.
en-mt: Experts stressed that people with disabilities, belonging to minority groups, the elderly, internally displaced persons, the homeless, those living in extreme conditions and prisoners have the right to health, as well as other non-professionals. Groups need government support.

sourceString: International governmental organizations are addressing the economic and social impacts of the COVID-19 crisis.
targetString: نړیوال دولتي سازمانونه د COVID-19 بحران اقتصادي او ټولنیزې اغیزې په ګوته کوي.
en-mt: International governmental organizations are addressing the economic and social impacts of the COVID-19 crisis.

sourceString: The Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development has launched a platform to provide timely and comprehensive information on policy responses in countries around the world, as well as viewpoints and advice.
targetString: د اقتصادي همکارۍ او پراختیا سازمان د نړۍ په شاوخوا هیوادونو کې د پالیسۍ غبرګونونو په اړه د وخت او هراړخیز معلومات چمتو کولو لپاره نظریات او مشورې وړاندې کولو لپاره یو پلیټ فارم پیل کړی.
en-mt: The Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development has launched a platform to provide feedback and advice to provide timely and comprehensive information on policy responses in countries around the world.

sourceString: From policies to strengthen health systems and the world economy to addressing the effects of lockdown and restrictions on travel, the digital hub includes a Country Policy Tracker, and aims to help countries learn from each other and to facilitate a co-ordinated global response to the coronavirus challenge.
targetString: د روغتیا سیسټمونو پیاوړي کولو او د تګ راتګ محدودیتونو اغیزو په نښه کولو لپاره د نړۍ اقتصاد ته د تګالرو څخه ، په ډیجیټل مرکز کې د هیواد پالیسي تعقیبونکی شامل دی ، او هدف یې د هیوادونو سره د یو بل څخه زده کړه او د نړیوال همغږي غبرګون اسانول دي. کوروناویرس ننګونه.
en-mt: From approaches to the global economy to strengthening health systems and addressing the impact of travel restrictions, the Digital Center includes a country policy tracker, and aims to help countries learn from each other and promote international coordination. The response is facilitation. The coronavirus challenge.

sourceString: The Chinese government has been criticized by the United States, UK Minister for the Cabinet Office Michael Gove, and Brazil President Jair Bolsonaro's son Eduardo Bolsonaro for its handling of the pandemic, which began in the Chinese province of Hubei.
targetString: د چین پر حکومت د متحده ایالاتو، د انګلستان د کابینې د وزیر مایکل ګوی، او د برازیل ولسمشر جیر بولسونارو زوی ادوارډو بولسناریو لخوا د چینایي ولایت په هوبي کې د دې ناروغۍ د مخنیوي په خاطر انتقادونه شوي دي.
en-mt: The Chinese government has been criticized by the United States, British Cabinet Minister Michael Gowe, and Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro's son Eduardo Bolsonaro for preventing the disease in the Chinese province of Hubei.

sourceString: A number of provincial-level administrators of the Communist Party of China (CPC) were dismissed over their handling of the quarantine efforts in Central China, a sign of discontent with the political establishment's response to the outbreak in those regions.
targetString: د چین د کمونست ګوند (CPC) ولایتي کچې اداري کارمندان په مرکزي چین کې د قرنطین هڅو په اړه د دوی د کارونو له امله له دندې ګوښه کړل شوي ، چې په دې سیمو کې د راوتلو په وړاندې د سیاسي تاسیساتو د غبرګون سره ناراضه دي.
en-mt: Provincial-level administrative staff of the Communist Party of China (CPC) have been fired over their work on quarantine efforts in central China, angering the political establishment's response to the outbreak in those regions. .

sourceString: Some commentators believe that this move was intended to protect Chinese Communist Party general secretary Xi Jinping from the public's anger over the coronavirus outbreak.
targetString: ځینې شنونکي پدې باور دي چې دا اقدام د چین د کمونست ګوند عمومي منشي شي جینپینګ د کورونا ویروس خپریدو په اړه د خلکو له قهر څخه خوندي کولو لپاره شوی وو.
en-mt: Some analysts believe the move was made to protect Chinese Communist Party General Secretary Xi Jinping from public anger over the spread of the coronavirus.

sourceString: Some Chinese officials, e.g. Zhao Lijian rejected an earlier acknowledgement of the coronavirus outbreak starting in Wuhan, in favour of conspiracy theories about the COVID-19 originating from the U.S. or Italy.
targetString: ځینې چینایي چارواکي، د مثال په توګه. ژو لیجیان د کورونیو ویروس خپریدو یوه پخوانۍ تایید رد کړه چې په اوهان کې پیل کیږي ، د COVID-19 په اړه د سازش تیوریو په حق کې چې د متحده ایالاتو یا ایټالیا څخه راځي.
en-mt: Some Chinese authorities, for example. Zhou Lijian rejected an earlier confirmation of the coronavirus outbreak starting in Wuhan, in favor of conspiracy theories about COVID-19 coming from the United States or Italy.

sourceString: The U.S. administration of Donald Trump has referred to the coronavirus as "Chinese virus" or "Wuhan virus" saying that China's "censorship supercharged a virus that has now turned into a global pandemic", which has in turn been criticized by some critics as racism and "distract[ing] from his administration's failure to contain the disease".
targetString: د ډونالډ ټرمپ  ادارې کوروناویرس ته د "چینايي ویروس" یا "ووهان ویروس" په توګه اشاره کړې او ویلي یې دي چې د چین "سانسور یو ویروس سوپر چارج کړ چې اوس په نړیوال وباله بدل شوی دی" ، چې په بدل کې یې د ځینو منتقدین لخوا د نژاد پرستۍ په توګه انتقاد شوی او "د هغه اداره په ناروغۍ اخته کولو کې پاتې راغلو [پام وګرځول".
en-mt: Donald Trump's administration has referred to the coronavirus as the "Chinese virus" or the "Wuhan virus" and said that China's "censorship supercharged a virus that has now become a global pandemic", which in turn Criticized by some critics as racist and "his administration's failure to [attract attention".

sourceString: The Daily Beast obtained a U.S. government cable outlining a communications stratagem with apparent origins in the National Security Council, with the strategy being quoted as "Everything is about China.
targetString: ډیلی حیوان د متحده ایالاتو حکومت کیبل ترلاسه کړ چې د ملي امنیت شورا کې د څرګند سرچینو سره د مخابراتو سټراټیژم په ګوته کوي ، او د ستراتیژۍ په حواله ویل شوي چې "هرڅه د چین په اړه دي.
en-mt: The Daily Beast has obtained a US government cable detailing the communications strategy with apparent sources in the National Security Council, and the strategy is quoted as saying, “It's all about China.

sourceString: We're being told to try and get this messaging out in any way possible, including press conferences and television appearances."Outlets such as Politico, Foreign Policy, and Bloomberg have claimed that China's efforts to send aid to virus-stricken countries is part of a propaganda push for global influence.
targetString: موږ ته ویل شوي چې هڅه وکړئ او دا پیغام رسونې په هر ډول چې امکان یې ترلاسه کړئ ، د مطبوعاتي کنفرانسونو او تلویزیون څرګندونو په شمول. "سیاستونه ، بهرنۍ پالیسي ، او بلومبرګ ادعا کوي چې د چین لخوا د ویروس ځپلو هیوادونو ته د مرستې لیږلو هڅې د نړیوال نفوذ لپاره د تبلیغاتو یوه برخه ده.
en-mt: We're told to try and get that message out in any way possible, including press conferences and television appearances. "Politics, Foreign Policy, and Bloomberg claim that China's efforts to send aid to countries affected by the virus are part of a propaganda drive for global influence.

sourceString: EU foreign policy chief Josep Borrell warned that there is "a geo-political component including a struggle for influence through spinning and the 'politics of generosity'".
targetString: د اروپايي اتحادیې د بهرني سیاست مشر جوزپ بورریل خبرداری ورکړ چې "د جغرافیې سیاسي برخې شتون لري چې په دې کې د سپین کولو له لارې د نفوذ لپاره مبارزه او د سخاوت سیاست" شامل دي.
en-mt: The EU's foreign policy chief, Josep Borrell, warned that "there are geopolitical divisions that involve the struggle for influence through whitewashing and the politics of generosity".

sourceString: Borrell also said that "China is aggressively pushing the message that, unlike the US, it is a responsible and reliable partner."

en-mt: Borrell also said that "China is reciprocally pushing the message that, unlike the United States, it is a responsible and reliable partner."

sourceString: China has also called for the US to lift its sanctions off of Syria, Venezuela and Iran, while reportedly sending aid to the latter two countries.
targetString: چین همدا راز له امریکا وغوښتل چې د سوریې ، وینزویلا او ایران بندیزونه لرې کړي، په داسې حال کې چې د راپورونو له مخې وروسته دوه هیوادونو ته مرستې لیږي.
en-mt: China also urged the US to lift sanctions on Syria, Venezuela and Iran, while reportedly sending aid to the latter two countries.

sourceString: Jack Ma's donation of 100,000 masks to Cuba was blocked by US sanctions on 3 April.

en-mt: And among other countries, such as Germany, Austria, and Switzerland, mask-related reports have been reported; and the Czech Republic and Italy

sourceString: In addition, Turkey seized hundreds of ventilators destined for Spain.

sourceString: In early March, the Italian government criticized the European Union's lack of solidarity with coronavirus-affected Italy.

sourceString: Maurizio Massari, Italy's ambassador to the EU, said that "Only China responded bilaterally.

sourceString: Certainly, this is not a good sign of European solidarity."
targetString: په یقین سره، دا د اروپا د پيوستون ښه نښه نده. "
en-mt: Certainly, this is not a good sign of European integration. "

sourceString: On 22 March, after a phone call with Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte, Russian president Vladimir Putin arranged the Russian army to send military medics, special disinfection vehicles, and other medical equipment to Italy.
targetString: د مارچ په 22مه، د ایټالیا له لومړي وزیر جیوسپي کونټي سره د تلیفون له خبرو وروسته ، د روسیې ولسمشر ولادیمیر پوتین د روسیې اردو ته داسې روزنه ورکړه چې ایټالیا ته نظامي ډاکټران ، د نس ناستې ځانګړي وسایط او نور طبي تجهیزات واستوي.
en-mt: On March 22, after a phone conversation with Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte, Russian President Vladimir Putin instructed the Russian military to send military doctors, special anesthesia vehicles and other medical equipment to Italy.

sourceString: Italy's La Stampa newspaper cited an anonymous "high-level political source" that 80 percent of Russia's aid was "useless or of little use to Italy".
targetString: د ایټالیا لا سټمپا ورځپا ې یوه نامتو "لوړې کچې سیاسي سرچینې" ته اشاره کړې چې د روسیې 80 سلنه مرسته "ایټالیا ته بې ګټې یا لږه ګټه" وه.
en-mt: The Italian newspaper La Stampa cited a so-called "high-level political source" as saying that 80 percent of Russian aid was "of little or no use to Italy."

sourceString: The source accused Russia of embarking on a "geopolitical and diplomatic" charm offensive.
targetString: سرچینې روسیه د "جیوپولیټیک او ډیپلوماتیک" پام وړ عمل بللی.
en-mt: The source called Russia a significant "geopolitical and diplomatic" move.

sourceString: The President of Lombardy, Attilio Fontana, and Italian Foreign Minister Luigi Di Maio dismissed the media reports and expressed their gratitude.

sourceString: Russia also sent a cargo plane with medical aid to the United States.

sourceString: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said that "when offering assistance to US colleagues, [Putin] assumes that when US manufacturers of medical equipment and materials gain momentum, they will also be able to reciprocate if necessary."
targetString: د کرملین ویاند دمیتري پیسکوف وویل "کله چې د متحده ایالاتو همکارانو ته د مرستې وړاندیز کوي ، [پوتین] ګومان کوي کله چې د طبي تجهیزاتو او توکو تولیدونکي امریکا متحده ایالات ځواکمن کړي ، نو د اړتیا په صورت کې به دوی هم وکوالی شي".
en-mt: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said "when offering aid to his US counterparts, [Putin] assumes that if the medical equipment and supplies producers can power the United States, then they will be able to, if necessary." .

sourceString: The planned NATO "Defender 2020" military exercise in Germany, Poland, and the Baltic states, the largest NATO war exercise since the end of the Cold War, will be held on a reduced scale.
targetString: په آلمان ، پولینډ او بالتیک ایالتونو کې د ناټو پلان شوی "مدافع 2020" نظامي تمرینات ، چې د سړې جګړې له پای ته رسیدو راهیسې د ناتو ترټولو لوی جنګي تمرینات به په کمه کچه ترسره شي.
en-mt: NATO's planned "Defender 2020" military exercises in Germany, Poland and the Baltic states, NATO's largest military exercise since the end of the Cold War, will be held at a reduced scale.

sourceString: The Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament's general secretary Kate Hudson criticized the Defender 2020 exercise: "In the current public-health crisis, it jeopardizes the lives not only of the troops from the US and the many European countries participating but the inhabitants of the countries in which they are operating."The Iranian government has been heavily affected by the virus, with around two dozen parliament members infected as well as fifteen other current or former political figures.
targetString: د اټومي بې وسلې کولو عمومي سکتور کېټ هډسن د 2020 مدافع تمرین باندې نیوکه وکړه: "په اوسني عامه روغتیا بحران کې ، دا نه یوازې د متحده ایالاتو او ډیرو اروپایی هیوادونو د سرتیرو ژوند له خطر سره مخامخ کوي بلکه د هغو هیوادونو اوسیدونکي چې پکې پکې ګډون لري دوی عملیات کوي. "د ایران حکومت د ویروس له پلوه سخت متاثره شوی ، د پارلمان شاوخوا دوه درجن غړي په دې ناروغۍ اخته شوي او پنځلس نور اوسني یا پخواني سیاسي شخصیتونه.
en-mt: Kate Hudson of the General Sector for Nuclear Disarmament criticized the Defense 2020 exercise: "In the current public health crisis, it endangers not only the lives of the soldiers of the United States and many European countries, but also the citizens of the countries where "Iran's government has been hit hard by the virus, with about two dozen members of parliament infected and fifteen other current or former political figures.

sourceString: Iran's President Hassan Rouhani wrote a public letter to world leaders asking for help on 14 March 2020, saying that his country is struggling to fight the outbreak due to lack of access to international markets as a result of the United States sanctions against Iran.The outbreak has prompted calls for the United States to adopt social policies common in other wealthy countries, including universal health care, universal child care, paid family leave, and higher levels of funding for public health.

It has called for the United States to adopt social policies common to other rich countries, including universal health care, universal child care, family leave, and higher budgets for public health.

sourceString: Political analysts anticipated it may negatively affect Donald Trump's chances of re-election in the 2020 presidential election.Diplomatic relations between Japan and South Korea worsened due to the pandemic.

sourceString: South Korea criticized Japan's "ambiguous and passive quarantine efforts" after Japan announced anybody coming from South Korea will be placed in two weeks' quarantine at government-designated sites.

en-mt: South Korea criticized Japan's "ambiguous and ineffective quarantine efforts" after Japan announced that anyone arriving from South Korea would be placed in a two-week quarantine in government-designated areas.

sourceString: The South Korean society was initially polarized on President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.

en-mt: South Korea's program is considered a success in controlling the outbreak despite not quarantining the entire city. South Korean society was initially lukewarm on President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.

sourceString: Many Koreans signed petitions either calling for the impeachment of Moon over what they claimed to be government mishandling of the outbreak, or praising his response.The pandemic has allowed countries to pass emergency legislation in response.

en-mt: Many Koreans signed petitions either calling for Moon's enforcement of what they claim is the government's mishandling of the epidemic, or praising his response.

sourceString: Some commentators have expressed concerns that it could allow governments to strengthen their grip on power.

en-mt: Some analysts have expressed concern that this allows governments to tighten their grip on power.

sourceString: In Hungary, its parliament voted to allow the prime minister, Viktor Orbán, to rule by decree indefinitely, suspend parliament as well as elections and punish those deemed to have spread false information about the virus and the government's handling of the crisis.
targetString: په هنګري کې ، پارلمان د لومړي وزیر ویکتور اوربان ته اجازه ورکړه چې د غیر مشروع فرمان له مخې حکومت وکړي ، پارلمان او ټول ټاکنې وځنډوي او هغو کسانو ته سزا ورکړي چې د ویروس په اړه ناسم معلومات خپاره کړي او د کړکېچ په اړه د حکومت اداره کول.
en-mt: In Hungary, parliament allowed Prime Minister Viktor Orbán to rule by decree, suspending parliament and all elections and punishing those who spread false information about the virus and the government's handling of the crisis. to manage

sourceString: The coronavirus outbreak has been blamed for several instances of supply shortages, stemming from globally increased usage of equipment to fight the outbreaks, panic buying, and disruption to factory and logistic operations.
targetString: د کورونا ویروس خپریدل د اکمالاتو کمبود ډیری وختونو لپاره تورن شوي ، چې د پیښې سره مبارزه کولو لپاره د نړیوالې کچې د تجهیزاتو کارول ، د ډارونې پیرود ، او فابریکې او لوژیستیکي عملیاتو ته ګډوډي له امله رامینځته شوي.
en-mt: The outbreak of the coronavirus has been blamed for many times on supply shortages, caused by the global use of equipment to combat the outbreak, panic buying, and disruptions to factory and logistics operations.

sourceString: The United States Food and Drug Administration has issued warnings about shortages of drugs and medical equipment due to increased consumer demand and supplier disruption.
targetString: د متحده ایالاتو د خوراکي توکو او درملو اداره د مصرف کونکو غوښتنې او عرضه کونکي مداخلت له امله د درملو او طبي تجهیزاتو کموالي په اړه خبرداری خپور کړی.
en-mt: The US Food and Drug Administration has issued a warning about drug and medical equipment shortages due to consumer demand and supply disruptions.

sourceString: Several localities also witnessed panic buying that led to shelves being cleared of grocery essentials such as food, toilet paper, and bottled water, inducing supply shortages.
targetString: ډیری ځایونو د ویریدلو پیرود هم ولیدل چې له امله یې زیرمو د خوراکي توکو لکه د خوراکي توکو ، تشناب کاغذونو ، او بوتل اوبو پاک کړل شوي چې د اکمالاتو کمښت لامل شوی.
en-mt: Many places also saw panic buying, which led to stockpiles of food items such as groceries, toilet paper, and bottled water being wiped out, leading to a shortage of supplies.

sourceString: The technology industry in particular has been warning about delays to shipments of electronic goods.
targetString: د ټیکنالوژۍ صنعت په ځانګړي ډول د بریښنایی توکو بار وړلو ته ځنډ په اړه خبرداری ورکړی.
en-mt: The technology industry in particular has warned of delays to electronics shipments.

sourceString: According to WHO director-general Tedros Adhanom, the demand for personal protection equipment has risen 100-fold.
targetString: د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان عمومي رییس ټیډروس اډانوم په وینا ، د شخصي محافظت تجهیزاتو غوښتنه 100 چنده لوړه شوې.
en-mt: According to WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, demand for personal protective equipment has increased 100-fold.

sourceString: This demand has led to the increase in prices of up to twenty times the normal price and also induced delays on the supply of medical items for four to six months.
targetString: دا غوښتنه د دې لامل شوې چې د نورمال نرخ تر شل ځله پورې نرخونه لوړ شي او همدارنګه له څلور څخه تر شپږو میاشتو پورې د طبي توکو په تحویل کې ځنډ لامل شوی.
en-mt: This demand has led to price hikes of up to 20 times the normal price and has also led to delays in the delivery of medical supplies of four to six months.

sourceString: It has also caused a shortage of personal protective equipment worldwide, with the WHO warning that this will endanger health workers.
targetString: دا د نړۍ په کچه د شخصي محافظتي تجهیزاتو کموالي لامل شوی ، د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان خبرداری سره چې دا به روغتیایی کارګران له خطر سره مخامخ کړي.
en-mt: This has led to a worldwide shortage of personal protective equipment, with the World Health Organization warning that it could put health workers at risk.

sourceString: In Australia, the pandemic provided a new opportunity for daigou shoppers to sell Australian products into China.
targetString: په آسټرالیا کې ، د وبا ناروغي د ډایاګو پلورونکو لپاره نوی فرصت چمتو کړ ترڅو چین ته د آسټرالیا محصولات وپلوري.
en-mt: In Australia, the pandemic has provided a new opportunity for Diego retailers to sell Australian products to China.

sourceString: The activity has created a shortage of baby formula in some supermarkets and was subsequently banned by the Australian government.Despite the high prevalence of COVID-19 cases in Northern Italy and the Wuhan region, and the ensuing high demand for food products, both areas have been spared from acute food shortages.
targetString: دې فعالیت په ځینو سوپرمارکیټونو کې د ماشوم فورمول کمښت رامینځته کړی او وروسته بیا د آسټرالیا حکومت لخوا منع شوی. په شمالي ایټالیا او ووهان سیمه کې د COVID-19 قضیو ډیرې خپریدو سربیره ، او د خواړو محصولاتو تقاضا لوړه غوښتنه ، دواړه ساحې لري د خوراکي توکو له شدید کمښت څخه وژغورل شو.
en-mt: This activity led to a shortage of baby formula in some supermarkets and was subsequently banned by the Australian government. Despite the high prevalence of COVID-19 cases in northern Italy and the Wuhan region, and high demand for food products, both areas have been spared severe food shortages.

sourceString: Measures by China and Italy against the hoarding and illicit trade of critical products have been successful, avoiding acute food shortages that were anticipated in Europe as well as in North America.
targetString: د چین او ایټالیا لخوا د انتقادي محصولاتو ساتلو او غیرقانوني سوداګرۍ پروړاندې اقدامات بریالي شوي ، د خوراکي توکو له کمبود څخه مخنیوی چې په اروپا او شمالي امریکا کې تمه کیده.
en-mt: Measures taken by China and Italy to protect critical products and combat illegal trade have been successful, avoiding food shortages that were expected in Europe and North America.

sourceString: Northern Italy with its significant agricultural production has not seen a large reduction, but prices may increase according to industry representatives.

en-mt: Northern Italy, with its considerable agricultural output, has not seen a major drop, but prices may rise, according to industry representatives.

sourceString: Empty food shelves were only encountered temporarily, even in Wuhan city, while Chinese government officials released pork reserves to assure sufficient nourishment of the population.

en-mt: Empty food stocks have only been encountered intermittently, even in the city of Wuhan, while Chinese government officials are releasing pork stocks to ensure the population is adequately fed.

sourceString: Similar laws exist in Italy requiring food producers to keep reserves for such emergencies.

en-mt: A similar law exists in Italy requiring food producers to maintain reserves for such emergencies.

sourceString: Damage to the global economy has been felt in China: according to a media report on 16 March, the economy in China was very hard hit in the first two months of 2020 due to the measures taken by the government to curtail virus spread, and retail sales plunged 20.5%.
targetString: نړیوال اقتصاد ته زیان په چین کې احساس شوی: د میډیا راپور له مخې د مارچ په 16 ، د چین د اقتصاد د 2020 په لومړیو دوه میاشتو کې خورا ډیر زیان لیدل شوی چې د ویروس خپریدو کمولو لپاره د حکومت لخوا ترسره شوي ګامونو او پرچون پلورونو له امله. د پلور 20.5٪ کم شو.
en-mt: The damage to the global economy is felt in China: According to a media report on March 16, China's economy suffered the most in the first two months of 2020 due to measures taken by the government to reduce the spread of the virus and retail Due to sales. Sales fell 20.5%.

sourceString: As mainland China is a major economy and manufacturing hub, the viral outbreak has been seen to pose a major destabilizing threat to the global economy.
targetString: لکه څنګه چې اصلي ټاټوبی چین لوی اقتصاد او د تولید مرکز دی ، نو ویروس خپریدل نړیوال اقتصاد ته لوی بې ثباته ګواښ ګ .ي.
en-mt: As mainland China is a major economy and manufacturing hub, the spread of the virus poses a major destabilizing threat to the global economy.

sourceString: Agathe Demarais of the Economist Intelligence Unit has forecast that markets will remain volatile until a clearer image emerges on potential outcomes.
targetString: د اقتصاد د استخباراتو واحد مشر اګاټ ډیماریس وړاندوینه کړې چې مارکیټونه به تر هغه وخته پورې بې ثباته وي ترڅو روښانه احتمال د احتمالي پایلو په اړه څرګند نشي.
en-mt: Agate Demaris, head of the Economist Intelligence Unit, predicted that markets would remain volatile until a clear outlook emerged on the likely outcome.

sourceString: In January 2020, some analysts estimated that the economic fallout of the epidemic on global growth could surpass that of the 2002–2004 SARS outbreak.

en-mt: In January 2020, some analysts estimated that the economic impact of the pandemic on global growth could reach that of the 2002–2004 SARS epidemic.

sourceString: One estimate from an expert at Washington University in St. Louis gave a $300+ billion impact on the world's supply chain that could last up to two years.
targetString: په سینټ لوئس کې د واشنګټن پوهنتون د ماهر څخه یوه اټکل د نړۍ د اکمالاتو لړۍ باندې 300 + ملیارد ډالر تاثیر ورکړ چې ممکن تر دوه کلونو پورې دوام وکړي.
en-mt: An estimate from an expert at Washington University in St. Louis gave a $300+ billion impact on global supply chains that could last up to two years.

sourceString: The Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) reportedly "scrambled" after a steep decline in oil prices due to lower demand from China.
targetString: د پټرولیم صادرونکو هیوادونو تنظیم د راپور له مخې د چین څخه د ټیټې غوښتنې له امله د تیلو په نرخونو کې د پام وړ کمیدو وروسته "خړپول شوی" دی.
en-mt: The Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries is reportedly "in shock" after a sharp drop in oil prices due to lower demand from China.

sourceString: Global stock markets fell on 24 February due to a significant rise in the number of COVID-19 cases outside mainland China.

en-mt: Global stock markets fell on February 24 due to a significant increase in COVID-19 cases outside of China.

sourceString: On 27 February, due to mounting worries about the coronavirus outbreak, various U.S. stock indexes including the NASDAQ-100, the S&P 500 Index, and the Dow Jones Industrial Average posted their sharpest falls since 2008, with the Dow falling 1,191 points, the largest one-day drop since the financial crisis of 2007–08.

en-mt: On February 27, due to growing concerns about the coronavirus pandemic, various US stock indexes including the NASDAQ-100, the S&P 500 index, and the Joe Jones Industrial Average posted their fastest losses since 2008, with the Dow It fell 1,191 points, the biggest one-day decline since the 2007–08 financial crisis.

sourceString: All three indexes ended the week down more than 10%.

en-mt: All three indices ended the week down more than 10%.

sourceString: On 28 February, Scope Ratings GmbH affirmed China's sovereign credit rating, but maintained a Negative Outlook.

en-mt: On February 28, Scope Ratings GmbH affirmed China's sovereign credit rating, but maintained a negative outlook.

sourceString: Stocks plunged again based on coronavirus fears, the largest fall being on 16 March.
targetString: اسهامو بیا د کرونا وئروس په خاطر رکود وکړ، تر ټولو دېر رکود یې د مارچ په 16 وکړ.
en-mt: Stocks fell again due to the coronavirus, hitting their lowest point on March 16.

sourceString: Many consider an economic recession to be likely.
targetString: ډیری خلک اقتصادي بحران د تحمل وړ بولي.
en-mt: Many people consider the economic crisis to be bearable.

sourceString: Economist Mohamed El-Erian praised central banks' and states' timely emergency measures.
targetString: اقتصاد پوه محمد الایرن د مرکزي بانکونو او دولتونو په وخت سره عاجل اقدامات وستایل.
en-mt: Economist Muhammad Al-Ayran praised the timely and urgent measures taken by central banks and governments.

sourceString: Central banks are reacting more quickly than they did to the 2008 financial crash.
targetString: مرکزي بانکونه د 2008 کال د مالي بحران په پرتله اوس په لا ډېر ګړندیتوب سره کارونه تر سره کوي.
en-mt: Central banks are doing things faster now than they did during the 2008 financial crisis.

sourceString: Tourism is one of the worst affected sectors due to travel bans, closing of public places including travel attractions, and advice of governments against any travel all over the world.
targetString: توریزم یو له هغو سکټورونو څخه دی چې د سفرونو بندېدنې تر ټولو ډېر اغېزمن کړی چې د عامه ځایونو  او د توریستي جاذبو بندېدل پکې شامل دي، دولتونو په ټوله نړۍ کې د هر ډول سفر د بندېدو سپارښتنه کوي.
en-mt: Tourism is one of the sectors most affected by the travel ban, which includes the closure of public places and tourist attractions, prompting governments around the world to ban all travel.

sourceString: As a consequence, numerous airlines have cancelled flights due to lower demand, including British Airways, China Eastern Airlines, and Qantas, while British regional airline Flybe collapsed.
targetString: په پایله کې، ګڼو هوایي شرکتونو لکه: د بریتانیا هوایي شرکت، د چین شرقي هوایي شرکت، او کنتس خپل پروازونه د کمې تقاضا له امله لغو کړل په داسې حال کې چې د بریتانیا فلایت هوایي شرکت بیخي لغو شو.
en-mt: As a result, several airlines such as British Airways, China Eastern Airlines, and Qantas canceled their flights due to low demand, while British Airways canceled several flights.

sourceString: The impact on the cruise line industry was at a level never seen before.
targetString: د بېړیو تګ را تګ به بېسارې ډول اغېزمن شو.
en-mt: The movement of ships will be greatly affected.

sourceString: Several train stations and ferry ports have also been closed.

sourceString: The epidemic coincided with the Chunyun, a major travel season associated with the Chinese New Year holiday.
targetString: دا وبا د چون یون سره یو ځای واقع شوه چې  د چین د خلکو د سفرونو اصلي فصل دی چې د چین د نوي کال د رخصتیو سره تړاو لري.
en-mt: The outbreak coincided with Chun Yun, the main travel season for Chinese people that coincides with the Chinese New Year holiday.

sourceString: A number of events involving large crowds were cancelled by national and regional governments, including annual New Year festivals, with private companies also independently closing their shops and tourist attractions such as Hong Kong Disneyland and Shanghai Disneyland.
targetString: ملي او سیمه ییزو دولتونو د نوي کال مراسمونو په ګډون یو لړ پېښې چې ډېر خلک به پکې راټولېدل لغو کړې، او په ځیونو سیمو کې خصوصي شرکتونو هم خپل د دکانونه او توریسي جاذبې وتړلې لکه: هانګ کانګ، ډېزنیلنډ، او شانګهای ډېزنيلنډ.
en-mt: National and local governments have canceled a number of events, including New Year's celebrations, where large crowds would gather, and private companies have also closed their stores and tourist attractions in some areas, such as Hong Kong, Disneyland, and Shanghai Disneyland.

sourceString: Many Lunar New Year events and tourist attractions have been closed to prevent mass gatherings, including the Forbidden City in Beijing and traditional temple fairs.
targetString: د دې لپاره چې د خلکو د غونډېدو مخنیوی وشي، ګڼې تورېستي جاذبې او د نوي قمري کالونو پېښې لغو شوې لکه: په بېجینګ کې د حرام ښار مراسم، او د معبدونو سنتي چارې.
en-mt: To prevent public gatherings, many religious attractions and Lunar New Year events, such as the Forbidden City ceremony in Beijing, and temple rituals have been canceled.

sourceString: In 24 of China's 31 provinces, municipalities and regions, authorities extended the New Year's holiday to 10 February, instructing most workplaces not to re-open until that date.
targetString: د چین له ټولو 31 ښارونو څخه په 24 ښارونو کې، د شاروالیو او چارواکو له خوا د نوي کال رخصتي د فبروري تر 10 پورې وځنډېده او ډېری کاري ځایونو ته یې سپارښتنې وکړې چې تر یادې نېټې پورې خپل کارونه پیل نه کړي.
en-mt: In 24 of China's 31 cities, municipalities and officials postponed the New Year holiday until February 10, and advised many workplaces not to resume work until that date.

sourceString: These regions represented 80% of the country's GDP and 90% of exports.
targetString: یادي سیمي د چین د ناخالص داخلي محصولاتو 80 سلنه او د صادراتو 90 سلنه تشکیولي.
en-mt: The region accounts for 80 percent of China's gross domestic product and 90 percent of its exports.

sourceString: Hong Kong raised its infectious disease response level to the highest and declared an emergency, closing schools until March and cancelling its New Year celebrations.The retail sector has been impacted globally, with reductions in store hours or temporary closures.
targetString: هانګ کانګ د دې ساري ناروغۍ په خاطر د خپلو اقداماتو سطحه لوړه کړه او اضطراري وضعیت یې اعلان کړ، ښوونځي یې تر مارچ پورې وتړل او د نوي کال مراسم یې لغو کړل. د پرچون پېرلو سکټور په ټوله نړۍ کې د مؤقت بندېدلو او یا د کم کاري ساعتنونو له کبله اغېزمن شوی.
en-mt: Hong Kong has raised the level of its measures against the epidemic and declared a state of emergency, closed schools until March and canceled New Year celebrations. The retail sector has been affected by temporary closures or reduced working hours around the world.

sourceString: Visits to retailers in Europe and Latin America declined by 40%.
targetString: په اروپا او لاتين امریکا کې د پرچون پلورلو ځایونو ته د خلکو تګ را تګ 40 سلنه کم شوی.
en-mt: In Europe and Latin America, the number of people visiting retail outlets has decreased by 40 percent.

sourceString: North America and Middle East retailers saw a 50–60% drop.
targetString: په شمالي امریکا او منځني ختيځ کې پرچون پلورلو له 50 تر 60 سلنه کمی موندلی.
en-mt: Retail sales in North America and the Middle East are down 50 to 60 percent.

sourceString: This also resulted in a 33–43% drop in foot traffic to shopping centres in March compared to February.
targetString: دا د دې لامل شوی چې په مارچ کې، د فیبروري په پرتله، دوکانونو ته د خلکو پلی تګ را تګ له 33 تر 43 سلنه کمی ومومي.
en-mt: This led to a 33 to 43 percent drop in foot traffic in March compared to February.

sourceString: Shopping mall operators around the world imposed additional measures, such increased sanitation, installation of thermal scanners to check the temperature of shoppers, and cancellation of events.According to a United Nations Economic Commission for Latin America estimate, the pandemic-induced recession could leave between 14 and 22 million more people in extreme poverty in Latin America than would have been in that situation without the pandemic.
targetString: په ټوله نړۍ کې د خرڅلاو د مرکزونو مدیرانو ګن اقدامات پلي کړل لکه: د حفظ الصحې د کچې لوړول، د حرارتي سکنرونو نصبول تر څو د پېرودونکیو د بدن حرارت معلوم کړي، او د ځينو مواردو لغو کول. لایتن امریکا ته د ملګرو ملتونو د اقتصادي کمیسیون پر بنسټ، د وبا له امله رامنځ ته شوی اقتصادي بهران به په لاتین امریکا کې له 14 تر 22 ملیونه پورې کسان له جدي فقر سره مخ کړي او د وبا له ختمېدو وروسته به هم په همدې وضعیت کې پاتې شي.
en-mt: Sales center managers around the world have implemented measures such as: increasing hygiene levels, installing thermal scanners to detect the body temperature of customers, and canceling certain events. According to the United Nations Economic Commission for Latin America, the economic crisis caused by the pandemic will put 14 to 22 million people in serious poverty in Latin America and will remain in the same situation after the end of the pandemic. stay in

sourceString: In January and February 2020, during the height of the epidemic in Wuhan, about 5 million people in China lost their jobs.
targetString: د 2020 کال په جنوري او فبروري میاشتو کې،  په ووهان کې د وبا د لوړې کچې له امله کابو 5 ملیونه کسان بېکاره شول.
en-mt: In January and February 2020, nearly 5 million people lost their jobs due to the peak of the epidemic in Wuhan.

sourceString: Many of China's nearly 300 million rural migrant workers have been stranded at home in inland provinces or trapped in Hubei province.In March 2020, more than 10 million Americans lost their jobs and applied for government aid.
targetString: د چین له کابو 300 ملیونه کلیوال کارګرانو، ډېری یې په داخلي ولایتونو کې په کور کې ناست دي او یا په هوبي بند پاتې دي. د 2020 کال په مارچ کې، په امریکا کې له 10 ملیونه څخه زیاتو کسانو خپلې دندې له لاسه ورکړې او له دولت څخه یې د مرستو غوښتنه وکړه.
en-mt: More than 300 million Chinese rural workers, most of them are sitting at home in the inland provinces or stuck in Hubei. In March 2020, more than 10 million people in the United States lost their jobs and asked for help from the government.

sourceString: The coronavirus outbreak could cost 47 million jobs in the United States and unemployment rate may hit 32%, according to estimates by the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis.The lockdown in India has left tens of millions of Indian migrant workers (who are paid through daily wages) unemployed.The survey from the Angus Reid Institute found that 44% of Canadian households have experienced some type of unemployment.Nearly 900,000 workers lost their jobs in Spain since it went into lockdown in mid-March 2020.
targetString: د سېنټ لوئیس د فدرالي ریزرو بانک د تخمین له مخې، د کرونا وئروس شیوع کولای شي په متحده ایالاتو کې د 47 ملیونه دندو د له منځه تللو سبب شي او د بېکارۍ کچه 32 سلنه ته ورسېږي. په هندوستان کې بندیزونو کابو 10 ملیونه مهاجر کارګران (چې ورځنی مزد به یې تر لاسه کولو) بېکاره کړي. د انګوس رېډ انسټیټیوټ سروې ښیي چې 44 سلنه کاناډایي کورنیو په یو ډول بېکاري تجربه کړې ده. له کله نه چې د 2020 کال په مارچ کې په اسپانیا کې بندیزونه ولګول شول، په یاد هېواد کې کابو 900,000 کارکوونکي بېکاره شوي دي.
en-mt: According to estimates by the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis, the outbreak of the coronavirus could lead to the loss of 47 million jobs in the United States, and the unemployment rate could reach 32 percent. In India, the ban has put nearly 10 million migrant workers (who would otherwise earn daily wages) out of work. A survey by the Angus Reid Institute shows that 44 percent of Canadian households have experienced some form of unemployment. Since the restrictions were imposed in Spain in March 2020, almost 900,000 workers have lost their jobs in the country.

sourceString: During the second half of March, 4 million French workers applied for temporary unemployment benefits and 1 million British workers applied for a universal credit scheme.Almost half a million companies in Germany have sent their workers on a government-subsidized short-time working schemes known as Kurzarbeit.
targetString: د مارچ په دویمه نیمایي کې، 4 ملیونو فرانسوي کارکوونکو د بېکارئ د مؤقتو حقوقو غوښتنه کړې او 1 ملیون بریتانیایي کارکوونکو د نړیوالې مرستې د طرحې غوښته کړې ده. په جرمني کې کابو نیم ملیون شرکتونو خپل کارکوونکي د دولت لنډمهاله کاري پروګرامونو ته لېږدولي چې یاد پروګرام د کورزاربېټ په نامه یادېږي.
en-mt: In the second half of March, 4 million French workers applied for temporary unemployment benefits and 1 million British workers applied for the International Assistance Scheme. In Germany, almost half a million companies have transferred their employees to the government's temporary work program, which is called Korzarbet.

sourceString: The German short-time work compensation scheme has been adopted by France and Britain.
targetString: د جرمني لنډمهاله بدیله کاري طرحه د فرانسې او انګلستان لخوا منل شوې ده.
en-mt: Germany's temporary alternative work plan has been accepted by France and the UK.

sourceString: The performing arts and cultural heritage sectors have been profoundly affected by the pandemic, impacting organizations' operations as well as individuals—both employed and independent—globally.
targetString: د عملي هنرونو او فرهنګي میراثونو سکټورونه له وبا څخه په لوړه کچه اغېزمن شوي، او په ټوله نړۍ کې یې د اداراتو کړنې،، لکه د دنده لرونکو او بېکاره خلکو په څېر، اغېزمنې کړې دي.
en-mt: The performing arts and cultural heritage sectors have been highly affected by the pandemic, and it has affected the actions of institutions, as well as employed and unemployed people, around the world.

sourceString: Arts and culture sector organizations attempted to uphold their (often publicly funded) mission to provide access to cultural heritage to the community, maintain the safety of their employees and the public, and support artists where possible.
