sourceString: Recommendations for mask use by the general public vary, with some authorities recommending against their use, some recommending their use, and others requiring their use.
targetString: د ماسک کارولو سپارښتنې په عامه خلکو کې توپیر لري، ځینې چارواکي د نه کارولو تجویز کوي، ځینې یې د کارولو او ځینې یې د کارولو غوښتنه کوي.
en-mt: Recommendations for the use of masks vary among the public, with some authorities recommending no use, some recommending use, and some recommending use.

sourceString: Currently, there is no vaccine or specific antiviral treatment for COVID-19.
targetString: اوسمهال، د کووېډ-19 وېروس درملنې لپاره کوم واکسین یا وېروس ضد درملنه شتون نلري.
en-mt: Currently, there is no vaccine or antiviral treatment available to treat the Covid-19 virus.

sourceString: Local transmission of the disease has been recorded in most countries across all six WHO regions.
targetString: د ناروغۍ انتقال په محلي کچه د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان په ټولو شپږو سیمو، په ډېرو هېوادونو کې ثبت شویدی.
en-mt: Local transmission of the disease has been recorded in many countries in all six regions of the World Health Organization.

sourceString: Those infected with the virus may be asymptomatic or develop flu-like symptoms such as fever, cough, fatigue, and shortness of breath.
targetString: داسې کسان چې په وېروس اخته وي ښایي علایم یې ښکاره نه وي یا ښایي زکام په شان علایم لکه تبه، ټوخی، ستړیا او سالنډي ونلري.
en-mt: People who are infected with the virus may not have symptoms or may not have flu-like symptoms such as fever, cough, fatigue, and cough.

sourceString: Emergency symptoms include difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain or pressure, confusion, difficulty waking, and bluish face or lips; immediate medical attention is advised if these symptoms are present.
targetString: د بېړني حالت علایمو کې ساه اخیستنه کې ستونزه، د سینې دوامداره درد او فشار، ګنګستیا، له خوبه په سختۍ راویښېدنه، سور مخ او شونډې شامل وي؛ د دغو نښونښانو یا علایمو په رابرسېره کېدو سره بېړنیو طبي پاملرنو ترلاسه کولو تجویز کیږي.
en-mt: Symptoms of an emergency include difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain and pressure, congestion, difficulty waking up, red face and lips; Immediate medical attention is recommended upon the appearance of these signs or symptoms.

sourceString: Less commonly, upper respiratory symptoms such as sneezing, runny nose or sore throat may be seen.
targetString: په غیرعادي توګه، د پورته تنفسي سیستم علایمو کې پرنجی، اوبلنه پوزه، او یا ستوني درد شامل دي.
en-mt: Unusually, upper respiratory symptoms include sneezing, runny nose, or sore throat.

sourceString: Gastrointestinal symptoms such as nausea, vomiting and diarrhoea have been observed in varying percentages.
targetString: ګستروانټیسټینال علایم، لکه استفراق، کانګې او اسهال/نس ناستی په بېلابېلو فیصدیو کې لیدل شوي دي.
en-mt: Gastrointestinal symptoms, such as nausea, vomiting and diarrhoea/diarrhoea, have been observed in varying percentages.

sourceString: Some cases in China initially presented only with chest tightness and palpitations.
targetString: په لومړیو کې په چین کې ځینو پېښو کې یواځې د سینې بندوالی او زړه ضربان لیدل شوی دی.
en-mt: Initially, in some cases in China, only chest congestion and heart palpitations were observed.

sourceString: In some, the disease may progress to pneumonia, multi-organ failure, and death.
targetString: په ځینو کې، ناروغي تر سینه بغل، د ډېرو بدني غړو غیرفعال کېدلو او مرګ پورې رسېدلې.
en-mt: In some, the disease progressed to pneumonia, multiple organ failure, and death.

sourceString: This is called the incubation period.
targetString: دې ته د اینکیوبیشن مرحله وایي.
en-mt: This is called the incubation stage.

sourceString: The incubation period for COVID-19 is typically five to six days but may range from two to 14 days.
targetString: د کووېډ-19 د اینکیوبیشن مرحله په معمول ډول شپږ ورځې دی خو ښایي د دوه تر 14 تر مینځ توپیر ولري.
en-mt: The incubation period for Covid-19 is usually six days but can vary between two and 14 days.

sourceString: 97.5% of people who develop symptoms will do so within 11.5 days of infection.Reports indicate that not all who are infected develop symptoms.
targetString: 97.5% خلک چي علایم پکې ښکاره کیږي پر وېروس د اخته کېدو تر علایمو ښکاره کېدو پورې 11.5 ورځې وخت نیسي. راپورونه ښیي چې ټول هغه کسان چې په وېروس اخته کېږي، علایم پکې نه ښکاره کیږي.
en-mt: 97.5% of people who develop symptoms take 11.5 days from being infected with the virus to developing symptoms. Reports indicate that not all people who contract the virus develop symptoms.

sourceString: The role of these asymptomatic carriers in transmission is not yet fully known; however, preliminary evidence suggests that they may contribute to the spread of the disease.
targetString: د دغو علایمو پرته انتقالوونکو رول لاتراوسه ندی مالوم؛ خو بیا هم، لومړني شواهد ښیي چې دوی ښایي د ناروغۍ خپراوي کې مرسته وکړي.
en-mt: The role of these asymptomatic carriers remains unclear; However, preliminary evidence suggests that they may help spread the disease.

sourceString: The proportion of infected people who do not display symptoms is currently unknown and being studied, with the Korea Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (KCDC) reporting that 20% of all confirmed cases remained asymptomatic during their hospital stay.
targetString: د هغو په وېروس اخته کسانو تناسب چې علایم پکې نه ښکاره کیږي اوسمهال نامالوم دی او تر څېړنې لاندې دی. د ناروغیو د کنټرول او مخنیوي لپاره د کوریا مرکزونه راپور ورکوي چې د ټولو تایید شوو پېښو 20% په روغتون کې له علایمو درلودو پرته پاتې وو.
en-mt: The proportion of people infected with the virus who do not show symptoms is currently unknown and under investigation. The Korea Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reports that 20% of all confirmed cases remained asymptomatic in the hospital.

sourceString: China's National Health Commission began including asymptomatic cases in its daily cases on 1 April; of the 166 infections on that day, 130 (78%) were asymptomatic at the time of testing.
targetString: د چین روغتیا ملي کمیسیون له اپرېل 1 نېټې څخه راپدېخوا په ورځنیو پېښو کې د علایمو نه ښودونکو پېښو ثبتول هم پیل کړل؛ په همدې ورځ له 166 څخه په وېروس اخته کسانو څخه د معاینې پر مهال 130 یا 78% کسانو کي علایم نه ښکاره کېدل.
en-mt: The National Health Commission of China has also started recording asymptomatic cases in daily cases since April 1; On the same day, 130 or 78% of the 166 people infected with the virus did not show symptoms.

sourceString: Both sputum and saliva can carry large viral loads.
targetString: په لاړو او هم په بلغمو کې یې په لوړه کچه وېروس شتون درلود.
en-mt: There was a high level of virus in his saliva and mucus.

sourceString: Loud talking releases more droplets than normal talking.
targetString: تر عادي خبرو کولو په لوړ اواز خبرې کول ډېر څاڅکي خوشې کوي.
en-mt: Talking louder than normal talking releases more droplets.

sourceString: A study in Singapore found that an uncovered cough can lead to droplets travelling up to 4.5 meters (15 feet).
targetString: په سینګاپور کې یوې څېړنې ومونده چې یو بېپوښه ټوخی کولی شي د خولې څاڅکي تر 4.5 مترو (15 فوټه) پورې ولېږدوي.
en-mt: A study in Singapore found that an unconscious cough can send droplets of sweat up to 4.5 meters (15 feet).

sourceString: Though the virus is not generally airborne, the National Academy of Science has suggested that bioaerosol transmission may be possible and air collectors positioned in the hallway outside of people's rooms yielded samples positive for viral RNA.
targetString: که څه هم وېروس د هوا له لارې نه انتقالیږي، د ساینس ملي اکاډمۍ وړاندیز کړی چې د بایوایروسل انتقال ښایي امکان ولري او د هوا ټولوونکي وسایل چې د خلکو له خونو څخه بهر په دهلیز کې نصب شوي وو، داسې نمونې پیدا کړې چې وېروسي ار این اې یې مثبتې وې.
en-mt: Although the virus is not airborne, the National Academy of Sciences has suggested that bioaerosol transmission may be possible, and air-collecting devices installed in corridors outside people's rooms have yielded samples that show viral ar. The results were positive.

sourceString: Some medical procedures such as intubation and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) may cause respiratory secretions to be aerosolised and thus result in airborne spread.
targetString: د پایپ تېرولو/اېښودلو او کارډیوپولمونري ریساسیټیشن په شان ځینې طبي پروسیجرونه ښایي د تنفسي ترشحاتو د ایروسولایزډ کېدو لامل وګرځي او وروسته په هوا کې د وېروس خپرېدو سبب شي.
en-mt: Certain medical procedures, such as intubation and cardiopulmonary resuscitation, may cause aerosolization of respiratory secretions and subsequent airborne transmission of the virus.

sourceString: While there are concerns it may spread via feces, this risk is believed to be low.The virus is most contagious when people are symptomatic; while spread may be possible before symptoms emerge, the risk is low.
targetString: که څه هم داسې اندېښنې شته چې د فاضله موادو له لارې انتقال شوی خو د دې خطر د باور کچه ټیټه ده. وېروس هغه مهال ډېر ساري وي چې خلکو کې یې نښې نښانې او علایم وي؛ په داسې حال کې چې د علایمو له راپورته کېدو مخکې خپرېدو امکان شته، او خطر یې ښایي کم وي.
en-mt: Although there are concerns that it has been transmitted through sewage, the level of confidence in this risk is low. The virus is most contagious when people have signs and symptoms; While it is possible to spread before symptoms appear, the risk may be low.

sourceString: The European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) says while it is not entirely clear how easily the disease spreads, one person generally infects two to three others.The virus survives for hours to days on surfaces.
targetString: د ناروغۍ د مخنیوي او کنټرول اروپایي مرکز وایي چې په داسې حال کې چې دا روښانه ده چې ناروغي څومره اسانه خپرېدای شي، خو یو کس کولی شي په عمومي توګه دوه تر درې کسان پر وېروس اخته کړي. وېروس پر سطحو باندې په ساعتونو یا ورځو ژوندی پاتې کیږي.
en-mt: The European Center for Disease Prevention and Control says that while it is unclear how easily the disease can spread, one person can generally infect two to three people with the virus. The virus can survive on surfaces for hours or days.

sourceString: Specifically, the virus was found to be detectable for one day on cardboard, for up to three days on plastic (polypropylene) and stainless steel (AISI 304), and for up to four hours on 99% copper.
targetString: په ځانګړې توګه، وېروس پر کاغذي تختو باندې تر یوې ورځې ژوندی وي، پر پلاستیک (پولي پروپایلین) او اوسپنه (اې آی ایس آی 304) باندې تر درې ورځو، او 99% مسو باندې تر څلورو ساعتونو ژوندی پاتې کېدی شي.
en-mt: Specifically, the virus can survive on paper plates for up to one day, on plastic (polypropylene) and steel (AIS 304) for up to three days, and on 99% copper for up to four hours.

sourceString: This, however, varies depending on the humidity and temperature.
targetString: سره له دې، پر دغو سطحو باندې د وېروس ژوندي پاتې کېدل پر رطوبت او د هوا درجې پورې اړه لري.
en-mt: However, virus survival on these surfaces depends on humidity and air temperature.

sourceString: Soap and detergent are also effective if correctly used; soap products degrade the virus' fatty protective layer, deactivating it, as well as freeing them from skin and other surfaces.
targetString: صابون او مینځونکي مواد چې په سمه توګه استعمال شي ډېر اغېزمن دي؛ د صابون اړونده مواد وېروس ډبل خوندي کوونکی پوښ له منځه وړي، غیرفعاله کوي یې، او همدارنګه له پوستکي او نورو سطحو څخه یې لرې کوي.
en-mt: Soaps and detergents used properly are very effective; Detergent-related ingredients destroy the virus's double protective coating, inactivate it, and remove it from the skin and other surfaces.

sourceString: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chlorhexidine gluconate (a surgical disinfectant), are less effective.In a Hong Kong study, saliva samples were taken a median of two days after the start of hospitalization.
targetString: همدارنګه نور محلولونه، لکه بینزالکونیم کلوراید او کلورهیکسیدین ګلوکونیت په کمه کچه اغېزمن دي. په هانګ کانګ کې د یوې څېړنې په ترڅ کې د لاړو نمونې په اوسط ډول په روغتون کې له بستري کېدو دوه ورځې وروسته واخیستل شوې.
en-mt: Other solvents, such as benzalkonium chloride and chlorhexidine gluconate, are also less effective. In a study in Hong Kong, stool samples were taken an average of two days after hospitalization.

sourceString: In five of six patients, the first sample showed the highest viral load, and the sixth patient showed the highest viral load on the second day tested.
targetString: له شپږو په پنځو ناروغانو کې، لومړۍ نمونه وښودل شوه چې وېروس په لوړه کچه اخیستل شوی، او شپږم ناروغ وښوده چې د معاینې په دویمه ورځ یې د وېروس اخیستو کچه لوړه شوې وه.
en-mt: In five of the six patients, the first sample showed a high viral load, and the sixth patient showed an increased viral load on the second day of testing.

sourceString: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a novel severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus, first isolated from three people with pneumonia connected to the cluster of acute respiratory illness cases in Wuhan.
targetString: د شدید حاد تنفسي علایمو لرونکی کورونا وېروس 2 (SARS-CoV-2) یوه نوې شدیده حاد تنفسي علایمو لرونکی کورونا وېروس دی، چې په لومړي ځل په ووهان کې د حاد تنفسي ناروغۍ پېښو لرونکې ډلې ته اړونده له درې سینه بغل لرونکو کسانو څخه جلا کړل شو.
en-mt: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a new severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus, which was first identified in three people with pneumonia related to a group of severe acute respiratory syndrome cases in Wuhan. separated.

sourceString: All features of the novel SARS-CoV-2 virus occur in related coronaviruses in nature.
targetString: د SARS-CoV-2 نوي وېروس ټول علایم په خپل طبیعت کې اړونده کوروناوېروسونو کې پیدا کیږي.
en-mt: All the symptoms of the new SARS-CoV-2 virus are similar in nature to related coronaviruses.

sourceString: Outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which bursts its protective bubble.SARS-CoV-2 is closely related to the original SARS-CoV.
targetString: د انسان له بدن څخه بهر، وېروس په کورونو کې د صابون په استعمال سره وژل کیږي، چې د وېروس ژغورونکی پوښ ماتوي. د SARS-CoV-2 وېروس له نږدې د SARS-CoV اصلي بڼې سره تړاو لري.
en-mt: Outside of the human body, the virus is killed by household soaps, which break down the virus' protective coating. The SARS-CoV-2 virus is closely related to the original form of SARS-CoV.

sourceString: The lungs are the organs most affected by COVID-19 because the virus accesses host cells via the enzyme angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2), which is most abundant in the type II alveolar cells of the lungs.
targetString: سږي د بدن هغه ارګانونه دي چې د کووېډ-19 له کبله ډېر اغېزمن کیږي، ځکه چې وېروس کوربه حجرو ته د انجیوټینسین بدلېدونکي انزایم 2 (ACE2) انزایم له لارې لاسرسی پیدا کوي، چې د سږو دویم ډول سوري لرونکو حجرو کې ډېر راټولېږي.
en-mt: The lungs are the organs most affected by Covid-19, because the virus gains access to host cells through the enzyme angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2), which accumulates in the second type of lung cells.

sourceString: The virus uses a special surface glycoprotein called a "spike" (peplomer) to connect to ACE2 and enter the host cell.
targetString: وېروس د سطحې له ځانګړي ګلایکوپروتین څخه کار اخلي چې د "سپایک/Spike" (peplomer) په نوم یادیږي او ACE2 انزایم پورې سریښیږي او د دې انزایم اړونده حجرو ته ننوزي.
en-mt: The virus uses a special surface glycoprotein called a "spike" (peplomer) to bind to the ACE2 enzyme and enter the host cell.

sourceString: Acute cardiac injury was found in 12% of infected people admitted in hospital in Wuhan, China, and is more frequent in severe disease.
targetString: د زړه حاد ټپ په 12% پر ناروغۍ اخته کسانو باندې چې د چین په ووهان ایالت کې روغتون کې بستري شوو وو وموندل شو او دا ډول پېښې په شدیدو ناروغیو کې ډېرځله رامنځته کیږي.
en-mt: Acute cardiac injury was found in 12% of infected people who were hospitalized in Wuhan, China, and such events occur more often in severe diseases.

sourceString: Rates of cardiovascular symptoms is high, owing to the systemic inflammatory response and immune system disorders during disease progression, but acute myocardial injury may also be related to ACE2 receptors in the heart.
targetString: د جهازي التهابي غبرګون او د معافیت سیستم کې د ګډوډۍ له امله د ناروغۍ د پرمختګ پر مهال د زړه ناروغیو د علایمو کچه لوړه وي، خو د زړه د عضلاتو ټپ ښایي په زړه کې د ACE2 انزایم ریسیپټور/اخیستونکي سره تړاو لري.
en-mt: Cardiovascular symptoms are elevated during disease progression due to vascular inflammatory response and immune system disturbances, but myocardial injury may be related to the ACE2 enzyme receptor/receptor in the heart.

sourceString: ACE2 receptors are highly expressed in the heart and are involved in heart function.
targetString: د ACE2 ریسیپټورونه/اخیستونکي په زړه کې راڅرګندیږي او د زړه کې خپل فعالیت ترسره کوي.
en-mt: ACE2 receptors/receptors appear in the heart and exert their activity in the heart.

sourceString: A high incidence of thrombosis (31%) and venous thromboembolism (25%) have been found in ICU patients with COVID-19 infections and may be related to poor prognosis.Autopsies of people who died of COVID-19 have found diffuse alveolar damage (DAD), and lymphocyte-containing inflammatory infiltrates within the lung.
targetString: د بېړنیو پاملرنو خونه کې د کووېډ-19 ناروغۍ اخته کسانو کې په لوړه کچه د وینې غوټه کېدلو پېښې (31%) او په رګونو کې د یونې غوټه کېدلو پېښې (25%) وموندل شوې چې لامل یې ښایي له ناروغۍ څخه کم پوهاوی وي. د کووېډ-19 له کبله د مړو جسدونو څېرې کولو کې د سږو په جوړښت کې ناوړه بدلون وموندل شو، او په سږو کې د لیمفوسایت لرونکی التهاب ننوځي.
en-mt: A high incidence of blood clots (31%) and venous thromboembolism (25%) was found in emergency room patients with covid-19, which may be due to lack of awareness of the disease. . Autopsies of covid-19 corpses revealed malignant changes in the structure of the lungs, and lymphocytic infiltrates in the lungs.

sourceString: Although SARS-COV-2 has a tropism for ACE2-expressing epithelial cells of the respiratory tract, patients with severe COVID-19 have symptoms of systemic hyperinflammation.
targetString: که څه هم د SARS-COV-2 وېروس د تنفسي سیستم د ACE2 ښکاره کوونکي ایپیتیلیال حجرو لپاره دفاعي سیستم لري، پر کووېډ-19 شدید اخته ناروغان د سیستمیک لوړې کچې التهاب علایم لري.
en-mt: Although the SARS-COV-2 virus has a defense mechanism for ACE2-expressing epithelial cells of the respiratory system, patients with severe infection with Covid-19 have high levels of systemic inflammatory symptoms.

sourceString: In particular, pathogenic GM-CSF-secreting T-cells were shown to correlate with the recruitment of inflammatory IL-6-secreting monocytes and severe lung pathology in COVID-19 patients.
targetString: په ځانګړې توګه د نارغي رامنځته کوونکی GM-CSF ترشح کوونکي T-cells حجرو کې وښودل شول چې د کووېډ-19 پر وېروس اخته ناروغانو کې د التهابي IL-6 ترشح کوونکي مونوسیتونو راټولېدنې او د سږو شدیدې زیان پېژندنې یا پتالوژۍ سره اړیکه لري.
en-mt: Specifically, T-cells secreting pro-inflammatory GM-CSF were shown to correlate with the accumulation of inflammatory IL-6-secreting monocytes and the prognosis or pathology of acute lung injury in patients infected with COVID-19.

sourceString: Lymphocytic infiltrates have also been reported at autopsy.
targetString: د جسدونو څېرې کېدو کې د لیمفوسیتیک انفیلتریتونو شتون راپور هم ورکړل شوی دی.
en-mt: Lymphocytic infiltrates have also been reported in necropsies.

sourceString: The WHO has published several testing protocols for the disease.
targetString: د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان د ناروغۍ لپاره د معاینې ډېر پروتوکولونه خپاره کړل.
en-mt: The World Health Organization has published many screening protocols for the disease.

sourceString: The standard method of testing is real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).
targetString: د آرمهال سرچپه ټرانسکریپشن پولیمیریز ځنځیري غبرګون (rRT-PCR) د معاینې معیاري میتود دی.
en-mt: Armhole reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) is the standard test method.

sourceString: The test is typically done on respiratory samples obtained by a nasopharyngeal swab; however, a nasal swab or sputum sample may also be used.
targetString: عموماْ، معاینه پر تنفسي نمونو باندې ترسره کیږي چې د نازوفرینجیال پیپ په وسیله ترلاسه کیږي. خو بیا هم، د پوزې د پیپ یا بلغم نمونې هم ښایي وکارول شي.
en-mt: Typically, the test is performed on a breath sample obtained through a nasopharyngeal swab. However, nasal pus or mucus samples may also be used.

sourceString: Results are generally available within a few hours to two days.
targetString: د معاینې پایلې د یو څو ساعتونو او دوه ورځو تر منځ لاسته راځي.
en-mt: Test results are available between a few hours and two days.

sourceString: Blood tests can be used, but these require two blood samples taken two weeks apart and the results have little immediate value.
targetString: د وینې معاینه ترسره کېدای شي، خو په دې معاینه کې د وینې دوه نمونې ضروري وي چې دویمه نمونه له لومړۍ نمونې څخه دوه اونۍ وروسته اخیستل کیږي او د هرې نمونې پایلې ترلاسه کول ډېر کم وخت ته اړتیا لري.
en-mt: A blood test can be done, but two blood samples are necessary in this test.

sourceString: Chinese scientists were able to isolate a strain of the coronavirus and publish the genetic sequence so laboratories across the world could independently develop polymerase chain reaction (PCR) tests to detect infection by the virus.
targetString: چینایي ساینسپوهان وتوانېدل تر څو د کوروناوېروس بڼه/اصلیت سره جلا او ارثي لړۍ یې خپره کړي، چې په دې توګه په ټوله نړۍ کې لابراتوارونه وکولی شي په خپلواکه توګه د وېروس له لارې د ناروغۍ د کشفولو لپاره د پولیمیریز ځینځیري غبرګون (PCR) معاینې ترسره کړي.
en-mt: Chinese scientists were able to isolate and release genetic sequences related to the form/origin of the coronavirus, allowing laboratories around the world to independently use polymerase chain reaction (PCR) tests to detect disease caused by the virus. to do

sourceString: As of 4 April 2020, antibody tests (which may detect active infections and whether a person had been infected in the past) were in development, but not yet widely used.
targetString: په 4 اپرېل 2020، د انټي باډي معاینې (چې فعاله ناروغي او دا چې یو کس مخکې هم پر ناروغۍ اخته شوی او کنه، پکې موندل کیږي) د پراختیا په حال کې وې، خو په پراخه توګه لاتراوسه ترې کار ندی اخیستل شوی.
en-mt: As of 4 April 2020, antibody tests (which detect active disease and whether or not a person has previously been infected) are under development, but have not yet been widely used.

sourceString: The Chinese experience with testing has shown the accuracy is only 60 to 70%.
targetString: له معاینې سره د چینایي تجربو ثابت شوی دقت او کره‌والی یواځې 60 تر 70% سلنې دی.
en-mt: According to the Chinese experiment, the accuracy and precision of the test is only 60 to 70%.

sourceString: The FDA in the United States approved the first point-of-care test on 21 March 2020 for use at the end of that month.Diagnostic guidelines released by Zhongnan Hospital of Wuhan University suggested methods for detecting infections based upon clinical features and epidemiological risk.
targetString: د امریکا متحده ایالاتو FDA په 21 مارچ 2020 د دې میاشتې په پای کې د استعمال لپاره د پاملرنې لومړی ټیسټ یا معاینه تایید کړه. د تشخیص هغه لارښودونه چې د ووهان پوهنتون ژونګنان روغتون له خوا خپاره شول، د کلینیکي علایمو او ایپیډیمیولاجیکل خطر پر بنسټ د ناروغیو د تشخیص لپاره د میتودونو سپارښتنه وکړه.
en-mt: The US FDA on March 21, 2020 approved the first point-of-care test for use at the end of this month. The diagnostic guidelines published by Zhongnan Hospital of Wuhan University recommended methods for diagnosing diseases based on clinical symptoms and epidemiological risk.

sourceString: Bilateral multilobar ground-glass opacities with a peripheral, asymmetric and posterior distribution are common in early infection.
targetString: دو اړخیزه شیشه‌یي تیارې له چاپېریالیز، متضاد او وروستي وېش په ژر رامنځته کېدونکو ناروغیو کې عامه وي.
en-mt: Bilateral vitreous opacities are common in early-onset diseases of peripheral, contralateral, and posterior distribution.

sourceString: Subpleural dominance, crazy paving (lobular septal thickening with variable alveolar filling), and consolidation may appear as the disease progresses.
targetString: سب پلورال تسلط او کریزی پېوینګ (د سږي الویولار یا سوري په متغییر ډول ډکېدو سره د لوبلار پردې ډبلېدل)، او یوځای کېدنه ښایي د ناروغۍ په پرمختګ سره راښکاره شي.
en-mt: Subpleural effusion and crazy-paving (collapsing of the lobular membranes with variable filling of the alveolar or sinus cavities), and consolidation may appear as the disease progresses.

sourceString: Few data are available about microscopic lesions and the pathophysiology of COVID-19.
targetString: د کووېډ-19 د مایکروسکوپیک ټپ او پتوفزیولوژي په اړه کمه ډېټا د لاسرسي وړ ده.
en-mt: Fewer data are available on the microscopic injury and pathophysiology of Covid-19.

sourceString: The main pathological findings at autopsy are:
targetString: د جسد معاینه کولو پر مهال د زیان پېژندنې مهمې موندنې په لاندې ډول دي:
en-mt: The main findings of injury during post-mortem examination are as follows:

sourceString: Macroscopy: pleurisy, pericarditis, lung consolidation and pulmonary oedema
targetString: ماکروسکوپي: پلیوریسي، پیریکارډېټیس، د سږو ډکېدل او pulmonary oedema یا د سږو په هوایي مجراوو او نسجونو کې د مایع راټولېدل.
en-mt: Macroscopically: Pleurisy, pericarditis, pulmonary congestion and pulmonary edema or accumulation of fluid in the airways and tissues of the lung.

sourceString: Four types of severity of viral pneumonia can be observed:
targetString: د وېروسي سینه بغل د شدت یا سختوالی څلور ډولونه کتل کېدی شي:
en-mt: There are four types of severity of viral pneumonia:

sourceString: mild pneumonia: pulmonary oedema, pneumocyte hyperplasia, large atypical pneumocytes, interstitial inflammation with lymphocytic infiltration and multinucleated giant cell formation
targetString: عادي سینه بغل: pulmonary oedema یا د سږو په هوایي مجراوو او نسجونو کې د مایع راټولېدل، pneumocyte hyperplasia، لوی نامعمول pneumocytes، د انټرسټیشیال/سوری لرونکي التهاب تر څنګ لیمفوسیتیک اینفیلټریشن او د لویو څو هستوي حجرو جوړښت.
en-mt: Typical pneumonia: pulmonary edema or accumulation of fluid in the airways and tissues of the lung, pneumocyte hyperplasia, large abnormal pneumocytes, lymphocytic infiltration with interstitial/porous inflammation and large multinucleated cells.

sourceString: severe pneumonia: diffuse alveolar damage (DAD) with diffuse alveolar exudates.
targetString: شدید سینه بغل: د سږو په جوړښت کې ناوړه بدلون (DAD) تر څنګ د سږو په سوریو کې التهابي ترشح.
en-mt: Acute pneumonia: Inflammatory secretions in the lung cavities along with malignant changes in lung structure (DAD).

sourceString: DAD is the cause of acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) and severe hypoxemia.
targetString: د سږو په جوړښت کې ناوړه بدلون (DAD) د سخت تنفسي ناروغۍ د علایمو (ARDS) او سختې هایپوکزیما له کبله رامنځته کیږي.
en-mt: Adverse pulmonary structural changes (DAD) are caused by acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) and severe hypoxemia.

sourceString: healing pneumonia: organisation of exudates in alveolar cavities and pulmonary interstitial fibrosis
targetString: رغېدونکی سینه بغل: د سږو په سوریو کې د التهابي ترشح او پولمونري انټرسټیشیل فیبروسیس رامنځته کېدل.
en-mt: Convalescent pneumonia: Inflammatory secretions and pulmonary interstitial fibrosis occur in the lungs.

sourceString: Blood: disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC); leukoerythroblastic reaction
targetString: وینه: په رګ دننه په پراخه کچه د وینې پرنډېدل (DIC)؛ لوکوریتروبلاستیک غبرګون
en-mt: Bleeding: massive intravascular coagulation (DIC); Leukoerythroblastic reaction

sourceString: Preventive measures to reduce the chances of infection include staying at home, avoiding crowded places, washing hands with soap and water often and for at least 20 seconds, practising good respiratory hygiene and avoiding touching the eyes, nose or mouth with unwashed hands.
targetString: پر وېروس د اخته کېدو چانسونو راکمولو لپاره د مخنیوي اقداماتو کې په کور پاتې کېدل، له ګڼې ګوڼې ځای څخه ډډه کول، لږ تر لږه د 20 ثانیو لپاره په اوبو او صابون لاسونه وینځل، د ښه تنفسي سیستم د پاکوالي ساتنه کول، او په ناپاکو لاسونو د خولې، سترګو، او پزې لمس کولو څخه ډډه کول دي.
en-mt: Preventive measures to reduce the chances of contracting the virus include staying at home, avoiding crowded places, washing hands with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, maintaining good respiratory hygiene, and Avoid touching the mouth, eyes, and nose with unclean hands.

sourceString: The CDC recommends covering the mouth and nose with a tissue when coughing or sneezing and recommends using the inside of the elbow if no tissue is available.
targetString: د د ناروغیو د کنټرول مرکز (CDC) له لوري د ټوخي یا پرنجي پر مهال په کاغذي دسمال سره د خولې او پزې پټولو سپارښتنه کیږي. د کاغذي دسمال په نشتون کې په څنګل سره د خولې او پزې پټولو سپارښتنه هم کوي.
en-mt: The Centers for Disease Control (CDC) recommends covering your mouth and nose with a tissue when you cough or sneeze. In the absence of paper towels, it is also recommended to cover the mouth and nose.

sourceString: Proper hand hygiene after any cough or sneeze is encouraged.
targetString: وروسته له هر ډول ټوخي او پرنجي پیدا کېدو څخه په سمه توګه د لاسونو پاکوالي مراعتول.
en-mt: After any cough or sneeze, keep your hands clean.

sourceString: The CDC has recommended the use of cloth face coverings in public settings, in part to limit transmission by asymptomatic individuals.Social distancing strategies aim to reduce contact of infected persons with large groups by closing schools and workplaces, restricting travel and cancelling large public gatherings.
targetString: همدارنګه، د ناروغیو د کنټرول مرکز (CDC) په عامه ځایونو کې د مخ پوښلو ټوکر/ټوټې کارولو سپارښتنه کوي تر څو د ناروغۍ د علایمو لرونکي شخص څخه د وېروس د انتقال کچه راکمه کړي. د ټولنیز واټن ستراتیژیو موخه، د ښوونځیو او کارځایونو تړلو، پر سفر محدودیت لګولو، او د لویو عامه غونډو لغوه کولو له لارې، له ډېرو خلکو سره په وېروس د اخته کسانو د تماس کچې راکمول دي.
en-mt: Also, the Centers for Disease Control (CDC) recommends the use of face coverings in public places to reduce transmission of the virus from a person with symptoms. Social distancing strategies aim to reduce exposure to large numbers of people infected with the virus by closing schools and workplaces, restricting travel, and canceling large public gatherings.

sourceString: Distancing guidelines also include that people stay at least 6 feet (1.8 m) apart.
targetString: د واټن لارښوونو کې دا هم راځي چې خلک دې له یو بل څخه لږ تر لږه 6 فوټه (1.8m) لرې اوسي.
en-mt: The social distancing guidelines also require people to stay at least 6 feet (1.8m) away from each other.

sourceString: There is no medication known to be effective at preventing COVID-19.As a vaccine is not expected until 2021 at the earliest, a key part of managing COVID-19 is trying to decrease the epidemic peak, known as "flattening the curve".
targetString: د کووېډ-19 ناروغۍ د مخنیوي لپاره په ښکاره ډول لا تراوسه اغېزمن درمل نشته.که څه هم د ناروغۍ واکسین تر 2021 پورې د تمې وړ ندی، خو د کووېډ-19 وېروس د مخنیوي کلیدي برخه لوړې کچې ته د ناروغۍ د پراختیا د راکمولو هڅه ده، چې د "منحني هوارول/پلنول" په نوم پېژندل کیږي.
en-mt: There is still no effective medicine to prevent the disease of covid-19. Although a vaccine is not expected until 2021, the key part of prevention of the covid-19 virus is to reduce the development of the disease to a high level. The effort is known as "curve flattening".

sourceString: The CDC also recommends that individuals wash hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, especially after going to the toilet or when hands are visibly dirty, before eating and after blowing one's nose, coughing or sneezing.
targetString: همدارنګه د ناروغیو د کنټرول مرکز (CDC) سپارښتنه کوي چې خلک دې څو ځله خپل لاسونه د 20 ثانیو لپاره ومینځي، په ځانګړې توګه تشناب نه له راوتو وروسته او یا هغه مهال چې لاسونه مردار/ککړ ښاري، مخکې له ډوډۍ خوړلو او وروسته له پزې پاکولو، ټوخي او پرنجي وروسته.
en-mt: Also, the Centers for Disease Control (CDC) recommends that people wash their hands frequently for 20 seconds, especially after using the bathroom or when hands are dirty/dirty, before eating, and after After clearing the nose, coughing and sneezing.

sourceString: It further recommends using an alcohol-based hand sanitiser with at least 60% alcohol, but only when soap and water are not readily available.For areas where commercial hand sanitisers are not readily available, the WHO provides two formulations for local production.
targetString: یاد مرکز د 60% الکول لرونکي لاسونو سنیټایزر/ضدعفوني استعمال سپارښتنه هم کوي، خو یواځې هغه مهال چې صابون او اوبه په ښکاره ډول شتون ونلري. په هغو ځایونو کې چې د لاس سوداګریز سنیټایزر په اسانۍ سره د لاسرسي وړ نه وي، د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان د محلي تولید دوه فورمولې وړاندې کوي.
en-mt: The center also recommends using 60% alcohol-based hand sanitizer/disinfectant, but only when soap and water are not readily available. In places where commercial hand sanitizer is not easily accessible, the World Health Organization recommends two locally produced formulations.

sourceString: In these formulations, the antimicrobial activity arises from ethanol or isopropanol.
targetString: په دې فورمولو کې، د میکروب ضد فعالیت له ایتانول یا ایزوپروپانول څخه راولاړیږي.
en-mt: In these formulations, the antimicrobial activity comes from ethanol or isopropanol.

sourceString: Hydrogen peroxide is used to help eliminate bacterial spores in the alcohol; it is "not an active substance for hand antisepsis".
targetString: هایدروجن پراکساید په الکولو کې د باکتري هګیو په لمنځه وړلو کې د مرستې لپاره کارول کیږي. دا "د لاسونو د میکروب له منځه وړلو لپاره یوه فعاله ماده نده".
en-mt: Hydrogen peroxide is used in alcohol to help kill bacteria eggs. It is "not an active ingredient for hand disinfection".

sourceString: Glycerol is added as a humectant.
targetString: ګلیسرول د یو رقیق کوونکې مادې په توګه اضافه کیږي.
en-mt: Glycerol is added as a diluent.

sourceString: People are managed with supportive care, which may include fluid therapy, oxygen support, and supporting other affected vital organs.
targetString: خلک په حمایوي پاملرنو سره اداره کیږي. په دې پاملرنو کې د مایع درملنه، اکسیجن ورکول، او د نورو حیاتي اغېزمن شوو ارګانونو/غړو سره مرسته کول شامل دي.
en-mt: People are managed with supportive care. These cares include fluid therapy, oxygenation, and support for other vitally affected organs/organs.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that those who suspect they carry the virus wear a simple face mask.
targetString: د ناروغیو د کنټرول مرکز (CDC) سپارښتنه کوي چې پر وېروس شکمن کسان دې یوه ساده ماسک واغوندي.
en-mt: The Centers for Disease Control (CDC) recommends that people suspected of having the virus wear a simple mask.

sourceString: Extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) has been used to address the issue of respiratory failure, but its benefits are still under consideration.
targetString: د بدن له پردې بهر اکسیجن ورکول (ECMO) د تنفسي سیستم د فعالیت له منځه تللو ستونزې حلولو لپاره کارول کیږي، خو د دې طریقې ګټې اوس هم تر غور لاندې دي.
en-mt: Extracorporeal oxygenation (ECMO) is used to treat respiratory failure, but its benefits are still being debated.

sourceString: Personal hygiene and a healthy lifestyle and diet have been recommended to improve immunity.
targetString: شخصي حفظ الصحه او د ژوند سالمه طریقه او غذایي رژیم د معافیت سیستم پیاوړي کولو لپاره تجویز کیږي.
en-mt: Personal hygiene and a healthy lifestyle and diet are recommended to strengthen the immune system.

sourceString: Supportive treatments may be useful in those with mild symptoms at the early stage of infection.The WHO and Chinese National Health Commission have published recommendations for taking care of people who are hospitalised with COVID-19.
targetString: حمایوي درملنې د هغو کسانو لپاره چې د ناروغۍ په لومړیو مرحلو کې عادي علایم لري، ګټورې دي. د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان او د چین د روغتیا ملي کمیسیون د هغو خلکو د پاملرنې لپاره سپارښتنې خپرې کړي چې پر کووېډ-19 د اخته کېدو له کبله بستري شوي کېږي.
en-mt: Supportive treatments are helpful for those with mild symptoms in the early stages of the disease. The World Health Organization and the National Health Commission of China have published recommendations for the care of people who are hospitalized due to infection with Covid-19.

sourceString: Intensivists and pulmonologists in the U.S. have compiled treatment recommendations from various agencies into a free resource, the IBCC.
targetString: په امریکا متحده ایالتونو کې فکري او د سږو متخصصین له بېلابېلو ادارو څخه د یوې وړیا سرچینې په توګه د درملنې سپارښتنې خپرې کړي دي، IBCC.
en-mt: In the United States, thinkers and lung specialists have published treatment recommendations as a free resource from various agencies, the IBCC.

sourceString: As of April 2020, there is no specific treatment for COVID-19.
targetString: په اپرېل 2020 پورې، د کووېډ-19 لپاره کومه ځانګړې درملنه نشته.
en-mt: As of April 2020, there is no specific treatment for Covid-19.

sourceString: For symptoms, some medical professionals recommend paracetamol (acetaminophen) over ibuprofen for first-line use.
targetString: ځینې روغتیاپالان د علایمو د له منځه وړلو لپاره د لومړي ځل کارولو په توګه تر ایبوپروفین څخه د پراسټامول (اسیتومینوفین) سپارښتنه کوي.
en-mt: Some health professionals recommend paracetamol (acetaminophen) over ibuprofen as a first-line treatment for symptom relief.

sourceString: Precautions must be taken to minimise the risk of virus transmission, especially in healthcare settings when performing procedures that can generate aerosols, such as intubation or hand ventilation.
targetString: د وېروس د انتقال خطر راکمولو لپاره باید احتیاطي اقدامات ونیول شي، په ځانګړې توګه په روغتیایي مرکزونو کې د هغو پروسیجرونو، لکه بدن ته د پایپ ننویستل او یا په لاس سره ناروغ ته هوا ورکولو د ترسره کولو پر مهال چې کولی شي په هوا کې ذرات تولید کړي.
en-mt: Precautions should be taken to reduce the risk of transmission of the virus, especially when performing procedures in health care facilities, such as intubation or manual ventilation of a patient, that may be airborne. produce particles.

sourceString: For healthcare professionals caring for people with COVID-19, the CDC recommends placing the person in an Airborne Infection Isolation Room (AIIR) in addition to using standard precautions, contact precautions and airborne precautions.The CDC outlines the guidelines for the use of personal protective equipment (PPE) during the pandemic.
targetString: د هغو روغتیایي کارکوونکو لپاره چې پر کووېډ-19 وېروس اخته کسانو پاملرنه کوي، د ناروغیو د کنټرول مرکز (CDC) د معیاري احتیاطي اقداماتو، د تماس د احتیاطي اقداماتو او هوایي احتیاطي اقداماتو په ګډون، د هوایي وېروس د جلاکولو خونه (AIIR) کې د ناروغ کس ځای په ځای کولو سپارښتنه کوي. د ناروغیو د کنټرول مرکز (CDC) د وبا پر مهال د شخصي خوندیتوب تجهیزاتو کارولو لپاره لارښودونه چمتو کوي.
en-mt: For health care workers caring for people with COVID-19, the Centers for Disease Control (CDC) recommends standard precautions, including contact precautions and airborne precautions, and the Airborne Virus Isolation Room (AIIR). Recommends placement of the patient. The Centers for Disease Control (CDC) provides guidelines for the use of personal protective equipment during an outbreak.

sourceString: The recommended gear is: PPE gown, respirator or facemask, eye protection, and medical gloves.When available, respirators (instead of facemasks) are preferred.
targetString: تجویز شوي توکي او وسایل څه داسې دي: د شخصي خوندیتوب طبي جامې، تنفسي اله یا د مخ ماسک، عینکې/د سترګو د خوندیتوب اله، طبي لاسماغوان/دستکشې. د امکان په صورت کې د مخ ماسک پر ځای تنفسي اله غوره ګڼل کیږي.
en-mt: Recommended items and equipment are: personal protective medical clothing, respirator or face mask, goggles/eye protection, medical gloves/gloves. If possible, a respirator is preferred over a face mask.

sourceString: N95 respirators are approved for industrial settings but the FDA has authorised the masks for use under an Emergency Use Authorisation (EUA).
targetString: د N95 تنفسي الې د صنعتي ځایونو لپاره تایید شوې دي، خو FDA د بېړنیو حالاتو پر مهال د کارولو رسمي اجازې (EUA) پر اساس د یاد ماسک کارولو اجازه ورکړېده.
en-mt: N95 respirators are approved for use in industrial settings, but the FDA has approved the use of these masks under an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA).

sourceString: They are designed to protect from airborne particles like dust but effectiveness against a specific biological agent is not guaranteed for off-label uses.
targetString: دا ماسکونه په هوا کې د ګرد او غبار په شان د ذراتو څخه د خوندیتوب لپاره جوړ شوي، خو د یو ځانګړي بیولوژيکي وېروس پر وړاندې یې د اغېزمنتیا ضمانت، له نښاني شوي استعمال پرته ندی شوي.
en-mt: These masks are designed to protect against particles such as dust and pollen in the air, but their effectiveness against a specific biological virus is not guaranteed unless indicated.

sourceString: When masks are not available, the CDC recommends using face shields or, as a last resort, homemade masks.
targetString: کله چې ماسکونه نه وي، د ناروغیو د کنټرول مرکز (CDC)د وروستۍ هڅې په توګه په کور کې جوړو شوو مخ ژغورونکو څخه د کار اخیستو سپارښتنه کوي.
en-mt: When masks are not available, the Centers for Disease Control (CDC) recommends using homemade face shields as a last resort.

sourceString: Most cases of COVID-19 are not severe enough to require mechanical ventilation or alternatives, but a percentage of cases are.
targetString: د کووېډ-19 ډېر شمېر پېښې دومره نه وي شدیدې چې میخانیکي تنفسي وینټیلېټور یا بدیلې الې ته دې پکې اړتیا ولیدل شي، خو په ځینو پېښو کې دا الې اړینې وي.
en-mt: Most cases of Covid-19 are not severe enough to require mechanical ventilators or other ventilators, but in some cases they may be necessary.

sourceString: The type of respiratory support for individuals with COVID-19 related respiratory failure is being actively studied for people in hospital, with some evidence that intubation can be avoided with a high flow nasal cannula or bi-level positive airway pressure.
targetString: د کووېډ-19 اړونده ناروغانو د تنفسي سیستم له کاره وتو د بیافعال کولو لپاره د تنفسي سیستم سره د مرستې ډولونه په فعاله توګه په روغتون کې تر څېړنې لاندې نیول شوي. ځینې شواهد ښیي چې د پایپ ننویستل باید د په پزه کې د تنفسي پایپ یا د دوه اړخیزې هوا د مثبت فشار ماشین (BiPAP) پر مهال و نه کارول شي.
en-mt: In order to reactivate the respiratory system of patients related to Covid-19, the types of respiratory support are actively being investigated in the hospital. Some evidence suggests that intubation should not be used while using a nasogastric tube or BiPAP machine.

sourceString: Whether either of these two leads to the same benefit for people who are critically ill is not known.
targetString: دا چې ایا دا دواړه طریقې به په یوشان ډول د هغو کسانو لپاره چې په شدید ډول ناروغ وي په ګټه تمام شي کنه، نامالومه ده.
en-mt: Whether these two approaches will equally benefit those who are critically ill is unclear.

sourceString: Some doctors prefer staying with invasive mechanical ventilation when available because this technique limits the spread of aerosol particles compared to a high flow nasal cannula.Severe cases are most common in older adults (those older than 60 years, and especially those older than 80 years).
targetString: ځینې ډاکټران د خولې له لارې میخانیکي وینټیلېټور کارولو ته ترجیح ورکوي ځکه چې دا ډول تخنیک په پزه کې د تنفسي پایپ اچولو په پرتله د هوا د ذراتو خپراوی ډېر محدودوی. شدیدې پېښې په عموم کې سپین ږیرو کې (چې له 60 څخه یې عمر ډېر وي، او مخصوصا هغه چې له 80 کلونو څخه یې عمر لوړ وي) ډېر وي.
en-mt: Some doctors prefer to use a mechanical ventilator through the mouth because this technique limits the spread of airborne particles more than inserting a breathing tube into the nose. Severe cases are generally more common in white men (those over 60, and especially those over 80).

sourceString: Many developed countries do not have enough hospital beds per capita, which limits a health system's capacity to handle a sudden spike in the number of COVID-19 cases severe enough to require hospitalisation.
targetString: ډېر شمېر پرمختللي هېوادونه د هر کس لپاره په روغتونونو کې کافي اندازه بسترونه نلري. دا کار د روغتیایي سیستم ظرفیت محدودوي تر څو د هغه شمېر کووېډ-19 پېښو ناڅاپي لوړېدل کنټرول کړي چې د بستري کېدو لپاره یې اړتیا لیدل کیږي.
en-mt: Many developed countries do not have enough hospital beds for each person. This limits the capacity of the health system to control the sudden increase in the number of Covid-19 cases requiring hospitalization.

sourceString: One study in China found 5% were admitted to intensive care units, 2.3% needed mechanical support of ventilation, and 1.4% died.
targetString: په چین کې یوې څېړنې ومونده چې 5% ناروغان په ICU کې بستر شوي، 2.3% یې د وینټیلېټور میخانیکي مرستې ته اړتیا درلوده او 1.4% یې مړه شول.
en-mt: A study in China found that 5% of patients were admitted to the ICU, 2.3% required mechanical ventilator support, and 1.4% died.

sourceString: In China, approximately 30% of people in hospital with COVID-19 are eventually admitted to ICU.
targetString: په چین کې نږدې 30% په کووېډ-19 اخته ناروغان په اخر کې په روغتونونو کې ICU کې بستري شوي دي.
en-mt: About 30% of patients with Covid-19 in China are eventually admitted to hospital ICUs.

sourceString: Mechanical ventilation becomes more complex as acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) develops in COVID-19 and oxygenation becomes increasingly difficult.
targetString: میخانیکي وینټیلېټور هغه مهال نور هم پېچلی کیږي چې د حاد تنفسي ناروغۍ علایم په کووېډ-19 کې نور هم ډېرېږي او اکسیجن ورکول نور هم سختیږي.
en-mt: Mechanical ventilators become more complicated when the symptoms of acute respiratory disease worsen in Covid-19 and oxygenation becomes more difficult.

sourceString: Ventilators capable of pressure control modes and high PEEP are needed to maximise oxygen delivery while minimising the risk of ventilator-associated lung injury and pneumothorax.
targetString: هغه وینټیلېټورونه چې د فشار د کنټرول موډ او PEEP ظرفیت ولری باید د اکسیجن ورکولو کچه یې لوړه شي، په داسې حال کې چې  وینټیلیټور ته اړونده د سږو ټپ او نیوموتوراکس خطرونو کې دې هم کموالی راشي.
en-mt: Ventilators with a pressure control mode and PEEP capability should increase the rate of oxygen delivery, while also reducing the risks of ventilator-associated lung injury and pneumothorax.

sourceString: High PEEP may not be available on older ventilators.
targetString: د لوړې کچې PEEP ښایي پر زړو وینټیلیټورونو باندې ترسره نشي.
en-mt: High-level PEEP may not be performed on older ventilators.

sourceString: Research into potential treatments started in January 2020, and several antiviral drugs are in clinical trials.
targetString: د ممکنه درملنې په اړه څېړنې په جنوري 2020 کې پیل شوې او ډېر شمېر د وېروس ضد درمل په کلینیکونو کې ازمویل کېږي.
en-mt: Research into possible treatments began in January 2020 and many antiviral drugs are being tested in clinics.

sourceString: Remdesivir appears to be the most promising.
targetString: داسې ښکاري چې ریمدیسیویر ډېر هېله بخښونکي درمل شي.
en-mt: Remdesivir appears to be a very promising drug.

sourceString: Although new medications may take until 2021 to develop, several of the medications being tested are already approved for other uses or are already in advanced testing.
targetString: که څه هم نوي درمل جوړول ښایي تر 2021 پورې دوام وکړي، ډېر شمېر ازمویل شوي درمل له وړاندې د نور استعمال لپاره تایید شوي یا له وړاندې په پرمختللي شکل ازمویل کیږي.
en-mt: Although the development of new drugs may continue until 2021, many of the tested drugs have already been approved for further use or are already being tested in an advanced form.

sourceString: Antiviral medication may be tried in people with severe disease.
targetString: د وېروس ضد درمل ښایي په شدید ډول ناروغو کسانو باندې وازمویل شي.
en-mt: Antiretroviral drugs may be tried in severely ill people.

sourceString: The WHO recommended volunteers take part in trials of the effectiveness and safety of potential treatments.The FDA has granted temporary authorisation to convalescent plasma as an experimental treatment in cases where the person's life is seriously or immediately threatened.
targetString: د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان رضاکارانو څخه غوښتنه کوي تر څو د ممکنه درملنو د اغېزمنتیا او خوندیتوب په ازموینو کې برخه واخلي. د FDA ادارې په هغو پېښو کې چې د ناروغ ژوند په شدید او بېړني ډول تر ګواښ لاندې وي، د یوې تجربوي درملنې په توګه د رغول شوي ناروغ پلازما ورکولو موقتي رسمي اجازه ورکړه.
en-mt: The World Health Organization is asking for volunteers to participate in tests of the effectiveness and safety of potential treatments. The FDA has granted temporary approval for the donation of reconstituted patient plasma as an experimental treatment in cases where the patient's life is seriously and urgently threatened.

sourceString: It has not undergone the clinical studies needed to show it is safe and effective for the disease.
targetString: دا تجربوي درملنه د کلینیکي څېړنو په ترڅ کې نده تجربه شوې چې وښیي د ناروغۍ لپاره خوندي او اغېزمنه ده.
en-mt: This experimental treatment has not been tested in clinical trials to show that it is safe and effective for the disease.

sourceString: In February 2020, China launched a mobile app to deal with the disease outbreak.
targetString: په فبروري 2020 کې، په چین کې د موبایل یو اپلیکیشن جوړ شو تر څو د ناروغۍ له خپراوي سره مبارزه کې مرسته وکړي.
en-mt: In February 2020, a mobile app was created in China to help fight the spread of the disease.

sourceString: Users are asked to enter their name and ID number.
targetString: له کاروونکو پوښتل کیږي چې خپل نوم او د هویت نمبر پکې ولیکي.
en-mt: Users are asked to enter their name and ID number.

sourceString: The app is able to detect 'close contact' using surveillance data and therefore a potential risk of infection.
targetString: اپلیکیشن د څارنې ډېټا په کارولو سره "نږدې اړیکې" او پر ناروغۍ د اخته کېدو ممکنه خطر موندلی شي.
en-mt: The app uses surveillance data to find "close contacts" and potential risk of contracting the disease.

sourceString: Every user can also check the status of three other users.
targetString: هر کاروونکی د نورو درېیو کاروونکو حالت هم کتلی شي.
en-mt: Each user can also view the status of three other users.

sourceString: If a potential risk is detected, the app not only recommends self-quarantine, it also alerts local health officials.Big data analytics on cellphone data, facial recognition technology, mobile phone tracking and artificial intelligence are used to track infected people and people whom they contacted in South Korea, Taiwan and Singapore.
targetString: که چېرته ممکنه خطر وموندل شي، اپلیکیشن نه یواځې د ځان قرنطین کولو سپارښتنه کوي، بلکې سیمه‌ییز روغتیایي چارواکي هم خبروي. د موبایل ډېټا باندې د لویې کچې ډېټا تحلیلونو، د څېرې پېژندنې ټکنالوژۍ، د موبایل څارنې او مصنوعي استخباراتو نه کار اخیستل کیږی تر څو هغه ناروغ خلک وڅاري چې په سهیلي کوریا، تایوان او سینګاپور کې یې له خلکو سره اړیکه نیولې وي.
en-mt: If a possible risk is detected, the application not only recommends self-quarantine, but also informs the local health authorities. Big data analytics, facial recognition technology, mobile surveillance and artificial intelligence are being used on mobile data to track sick people who have been in contact with people in South Korea, Taiwan and Singapore.

sourceString: In March 2020, the Israeli government enabled security agencies to track mobile phone data of people supposed to have coronavirus.
targetString: په مارچ 2020 کې، د اسراییلو حکومت امنیتي ادارو غوښتنه وکړه تر څو د هغو خلکو موبایل ډېټا وڅاري چې ښایي کورونا ولري.
en-mt: In March 2020, the Israeli government asked security agencies to monitor the mobile data of people who may have the corona virus.

sourceString: The measure was taken to enforce quarantine and protect those who may come into contact with infected citizens.
targetString: دا اقدام د قرنطین د عملي کولو او د هغو خلکو خوندي کولو لپاره واخیستل شو چې ښایي په وېروس اخته کسانو سره اړیکه ونیسي.
en-mt: This measure was taken to enforce quarantine and protect people who may have come in contact with people infected with the virus.

sourceString: Also in March 2020, Deutsche Telekom shared aggregated phone location data with the German federal government agency, Robert Koch Institute, in order to research and prevent the spread of the virus.
targetString: همدارنګه مارچ 2020 کې، ډچ ټیلیکام د جرمني فدرالي دولت ادارې، رابرټ کوچ انسټیټوټ سره د موبایل د موقعیت راټوله شوې ډېټا شریکه کړه تر څو د وېروس په اړه څېړنه وکړي او د خپرېدو مخنیوی یې وکړي.
en-mt: Also in March 2020, Deutsche Telekom shared collected mobile location data with the Robert Koch Institute, a German federal government agency, to investigate and prevent the spread of the virus.

sourceString: Russia deployed facial recognition technology to detect quarantine breakers.
targetString: روسیې د څېرې پېژندنې ټکنالوژي وګمارله تر څو د قرنطین ماتوونکي په ګوته او پیدا کړي.
en-mt: Russia deploys facial recognition technology to identify quarantine breakers

sourceString: Italian regional health commissioner Giulio Gallera said he has been informed by mobile phone operators that "40% of people are continuing to move around anyway".
targetString: د ایټالیا د سیمه‌ییزې روغتیا کمېشنر، ګولیو ګالیرا وویل چې هغه د موبایل تیلیفون اپرېټرانو له لوري خبر شو چې "40% خلک شاوخوا د ګرځېدو په حال کې دي."
en-mt: Italy's regional health commissioner, Guglio Galera, said he was informed by mobile phone operators that "40% of people are walking around".

sourceString: German government conducted a 48 hours weekend hackathon with more than 42.000 participants.
targetString: د جرمني حکومت د 42000 څخه ډېرو ګډونوالو په شتون سره د اونۍ په اخر کې 48 ساعته رخصتي ورکړه.
en-mt: The German government granted a 48-hour holiday weekend with more than 42,000 participants.

sourceString: Also the president of Estonia, Kersti Kaljulaid, made a global call for creative solutions against the spread of coronavirus.
targetString: د ایستونیا ولسمشر کیرستي کالجولید د کوروناوېروس د خپراوي پر وړاندې د پنځوونکو حلارو چارو لپاره غږ وکړ.
en-mt: Estonia's President Kirsti Kollevled has called for five-point solutions against the spread of the coronavirus.

sourceString: Individuals may experience distress from quarantine, travel restrictions, side effects of treatment or fear of the infection itself.
targetString: خلک ښایي له قرنطین، سفري محدودیتونو، د درملنې جانبي عوارضو یا له ناروغۍ/وېروس څخه له لورې خپګان تجربه کړي.
en-mt: People may experience stress from quarantine, travel restrictions, side effects of treatment or illness/virus.

sourceString: BBC quoted Rory O'Connor in saying, "Increased social isolation, loneliness, health anxiety, stress and an economic downturn are a perfect storm to harm people's mental health and wellbeing."
targetString: بي بي سي د روري اوکانر وینا راخیستي، وایي "ډېرېدونکی ټولنیز ایزلاسیون، تنهایي، روغتیایي تشویش، سټرس، او اقتصادي کښته والی د خلکو د ذهني روغتیا او هوساینې ته د زیان رسولو سمدم توفان دی."
en-mt: The BBC quoted Rory O'Connor as saying, "Devastating social isolation, loneliness, health concerns, stress, and economic downturns are creating a storm of damage to people's mental health and well-being."

sourceString: The disease may take a mild course with few or no symptoms, resembling other common upper respiratory diseases such as the common cold.
targetString: ناروغي ښایي د ځینو علایمو شتون یا نشتون تر څنګ او د عادي زکام په شان د ستوني نورو عادي ناروغیو په شتون سره په عادي حالت کې تېره شي.
en-mt: The disease may pass in a normal state with the presence or absence of some symptoms and with the presence of other common throat diseases such as the common cold.

sourceString: Mild cases typically recover within two weeks, while those with severe or critical diseases may take three to six weeks to recover.
targetString: عادي پېښې عموماْ تر دوه اونیو پورې ښې کیږي، په داسې حال کې چې د شدیدو او سختو پېښو رغېدل ښایي درې تر شپږ اونیو پورې وخت ونیسي.
en-mt: Normal cases usually take up to two weeks to heal, while severe cases may take three to six weeks to heal.

sourceString: Pregnant women may be at higher risk for severe infection with COVID-19 based on data from other similar viruses, like SARS and MERS, but data for COVID-19 is lacking.In some people, COVID-19 may affect the lungs causing pneumonia.
targetString: د SARS او MERS ته ورته وېروسونو ډېټا پر بنسټ، امیندوارې ښځې د کووېډ-19 ناروغۍ د شدت له کبله لوړ خطر سره دي، خو د کووېډ-19 په اړه اړونده ډېټا شتون نلري. پر کووېډ-19 ځینو اخته کسانو سږي ښایي اغېزمن شي او سینه بغل رامنځته کړي.
en-mt: Based on data from viruses such as SARS and MERS, pregnant women are at higher risk for severe illness from Covid-19, but no relevant data are available for Covid-19. The lungs of some people with Covid-19 can be affected and cause pneumonia.

sourceString: In those most severely affected, COVID-19 may rapidly progress to acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) causing respiratory failure, septic shock or multi-organ failure.
targetString: په شدید ډول اغېزمن شوو خلکو کې، کووېډ-19 وېروس ښایي په چټکۍ سره د حاد تنفسي ناروغۍ علایم (ARDS) رامنځته کړي چې په پایله کې د تنفسي سیستم له فعالیته غورځېد، په ټول بدن کې د وېروس خپرېدو او د بدن د ډېرو غړو له فعالیته غورځېدو لامل شي.
en-mt: In severely affected people, the Covid-19 virus can rapidly cause acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS), which results in respiratory failure, spread of the virus throughout the body, and spread to multiple organs. cause it to fail.

sourceString: Complications associated with COVID-19 include sepsis, abnormal clotting and damage to the heart, kidneys and liver.
targetString: د کووېډ-19 اړونده پیچلي حالتونه، په ټول بدن کې د وېروس خپرېدل، د وینې غوټېدل په ناعادي ډول، زړه، پښتورګو او جګر ته زیان رسېدل دي.
en-mt: Complications related to Covid-19 include the spread of the virus throughout the body, abnormal bleeding, damage to the heart, kidneys and liver.

sourceString: Clotting abnormalities, specifically an increase in prothrombin time, have been described in 6% of those admitted to hospital with COVID-19, while abnormal kidney function is seen in 4% of this group.
targetString: د وینې غوټه کېدل، په ځانګړې توګه د پروترومبین په وخت کې د ډېروالي پر مهال، په روغتونونو کې د کووېډ-19 په 6%  بستري شوو ناروغانو کي موندل شوی دی، په داسې حال کې چې پښتورګو ناعادي فعالیت د دې ډلې په 4% ناروغانو کې لیدل شوی دی.
en-mt: Bleeding, especially during an increase in prothrombin time, was found in 6% of hospitalized Covid-19 patients, while abnormal kidney function was found in 4% of this group. It has been observed in patients.

sourceString: Approximately 20-30% of people who present with COVID-19 demonstrate elevated liver enzymes (transaminases).
targetString: د نږدې 20-30% هغو خلکو د جګر د ټرانسامیناسیس انزایم په کچه کې ډېروالی لیدل شوی، چي پر کووېډ-19 باندې اخته وو.
en-mt: About 20-30% of people with Covid-19 have elevated liver transaminase enzyme levels.

sourceString: According to the same report, the median time between onset of symptoms and death was ten days, with five being spent hospitalised.
targetString: د همدې راپور له مخې، د علایمو پیلېدو او مرګ تر منځ اوسط وخت، په روغتون کې د پنځو ورځو ترڅنګ لس ورځې وو.
en-mt: According to the same report, the average time between the onset of symptoms and death was ten days, along with five days in the hospital.

sourceString: However, patients transferred to an ICU had a median time of seven days between hospitalisation and death.
targetString: سربېره پردې، هغه خلک چې ICU خونې ته لېږدول شوي، د بستري کېدو او مرګ تر منځ اوسط وخت یې اووه ورځې وو.
en-mt: In addition, people who were transferred to the ICU room had an average time between admission and death of seven days.

sourceString: In a study of early cases, the median time from exhibiting initial symptoms to death was 14 days, with a full range of six to 41 days.
targetString: د لومړنیو پېښو د یوې څېړنې له مخې، د لومړنیو علایمو له علایمو او تر مرګ پورې اوسط وخت 14 ورځې وو، چې په ټولیز ډول د ناروغانو د ناروغه کېدو او د مرګ تر وخت پورې ټول وخت له شپږو تر 41 ورځو پورې وو.
en-mt: According to an early case study, the median time from the onset of symptoms to death was 14 days, with a total of 6 to 41 days from onset of illness to death.

sourceString: In a study by the National Health Commission (NHC) of China, men had a death rate of 2.8% while women had a death rate of 1.7%.
targetString: د چین د روغتیا ملي کمیسیون د یوې څېړنې له مخې، د سړیو د مرګ کچه 2.8%، په داسې حال کې چې د ښځو د مرګ کچه 1.7% ښودل شوی.
en-mt: According to a study by the National Health Commission of China, the death rate for men is 2.8%, while the death rate for women is 1.7%.

sourceString: Histopathological examinations of post-mortem lung samples show diffuse alveolar damage with cellular fibromyxoid exudates in both lungs.
targetString: له مرګ څخه وروسته د سږو د نمونو هیستوپاتولاجیکل معایناتو کې د دواړو سږو د نسجونو ټپونه او ورسره په دواړو سږو کې د حجروي فیبرومایکسوید التهابي ترشح وښودل شو.
en-mt: Post-mortem histopathological examination of lung specimens showed tissue injury in both lungs with cellular fibromyxoid inflammatory infiltrates in both lungs.

sourceString: Viral cytopathic changes were observed in the pneumocytes.
targetString: د وېروس سایتوپاتیک بدلونونه په نوموسایتیس کې مشاهده کړل شو.
en-mt: Viral cytopathic changes were observed in nomocytes.

sourceString: The lung picture resembled acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).
targetString: د سږو انځور د حاد تنفسي ناروغۍ علایمو سره ورته والی درلود.
en-mt: The pulmonary picture was similar to the symptoms of acute respiratory disease.

sourceString: In 11.8% of the deaths reported by the National Health Commission of China, heart damage was noted by elevated levels of troponin or cardiac arrest.
targetString: د چین د روغتیا ملي کمیسیون له لوري په 11.8% راپور ورکړل شوو مرګونو کې، د ټروپونین کچې لوړوالی او د زړه درېدا اړونده د زړه ناروغۍ له سترګو شوي دي.
en-mt: In 11.8% of deaths reported by the National Health Commission of China, elevated troponin levels and heart failure were associated with cardiovascular disease.

sourceString: According to March data from the United States, 89% of those hospitalised had preexisting conditions.Availability of medical resources and the socioeconomics of a region may also affect mortality.
targetString: د امریکا متحده ایالتونو کې د مارچ میاشتې ډېټا له مخې، 89% بستري شوو ناروغانو کې له وړاندې نښې نښانې وې. طبي سرچینو ته لاسرسی او د یوې سیمې ټولنیز-اقتصاد ښایي پر مرګ ژوبلې باندې اغېزه کوي.
en-mt: According to data from March in the United States, 89% of hospitalized patients had pre-existing symptoms. Access to medical resources and the socio-economics of an area may influence mortality.

sourceString: Estimates of the mortality from the condition vary because of those regional differences, but also because of methodological difficulties.
targetString: له داسې حالت څخه د مړینو اټکل د سیمه‌ییزو توپیرونو، بلکې د میتودولوژیکي توپیرونو له کبله هم فرق کوي.
en-mt: Estimates of deaths from such a situation differ not only due to regional differences, but also due to methodological differences.

sourceString: The under-counting of mild cases can cause the mortality rate to be overestimated.
targetString: د عادي پېښو کم شمېر ښودل د مړینې کچې له اټکل څخه پورته ښودو لامل کېدای شي.
en-mt: Underreporting of normal cases may lead to overestimated mortality rates.

sourceString: However, the fact that deaths are the result of cases contracted in the past can mean the current mortality rate is underestimated.
targetString: خو بیا هم، دا حقیقت چې په تېر کې د اخته شویو پېښو له امله مرګونه په دې مانا ده چې د مړینو اوسني شمېر اټکل له واقعیته کم ښودل کیږي.
en-mt: However, the fact that deaths from infections in the past mean that the current death toll is underestimated.

sourceString: Smokers were 1.4 times more likely to have severe symptoms of COVID-19 and approximately 2.4 times more likely to require intensive care or die compared to non-smokers.Concerns have been raised about long-term sequelae of the disease.
targetString: تر سګرټ نه څښونکو، پر کووېډ-19 وېروس باندې په شدید ډول اخته کېدو احتمال په سګرټ څښونکو کې 1.4 ځله ډېر دی او په ICU کې د بستري کېدو او مړ کېدو احتمال یې نږدې 2.4 ځله ډېر دی. د ناروغۍ د اوږدمهاله عوارضو په اړه اندېښنې راولاړې شوې دي.
en-mt: Smokers are 1.4 times more likely than non-smokers to develop severe infection with the Covid-19 virus, and nearly 2.4 times more likely to be hospitalized and die in the ICU. Concerns have been raised about the long-term effects of the disease.

sourceString: The Hong Kong Hospital Authority found a drop of 20% to 30% in lung capacity in some people who recovered from the disease, and lung scans suggested organ damage.
targetString: د هانګ کانګ د روغتون چارواکو د هغو خلکو د سږو ظرفیت کې 20% تر 30% ټیټوالی په ګوته کړ چې له ناروغۍ څخه ښه شوي وي او د سږو په سکن کې د ارګانونو زیان ښکارېده.
en-mt: Hong Kong hospital officials noted a 20% to 30% drop in lung capacity in people who had recovered from the disease and showed organ damage on lung scans.

sourceString: This may also lead to post-intensive care syndrome following recovery.
targetString: دا کار ښایي له ناروغۍ د ژغورېدو په تعقیب ناروغ له ICU څخه له وتو وروسته فزیکي، ذهني او احساساتي علایمو باندې کړي.
en-mt: This can be done on physical, mental and emotional symptoms after the patient leaves the ICU following recovery from the disease.

sourceString: As of March 2020, it was unknown if past infection provides effective and long-term immunity in people who recover from the disease.
targetString: تر مارچ 2020 پورې، دا خبره نامالومه وه چې ایا مخکنۍ ناروغۍ په هغو خلکو کې چې له ناروغۍ څخه روغ رمټ کیږي، اغېزمن او اوږدمهاله معافیت رامنځته کوي او کنه.
en-mt: As of March 2020, it was unknown whether or not previous infections produce effective and long-lasting immunity in people who recover from the disease.

sourceString: Immunity is seen as likely, based on the behaviour of other coronaviruses, but cases in which recovery from COVID-19 have been followed by positive tests for coronavirus at a later date have been reported.
targetString: د کوروناوېروس نورو بڼو د چلند پر بنسټ، معافیت کې د تغییر احتمال شته، خو د هغو پېښو په اړه چې د کوروناوېروس د مثبتو معایناتو وروسته، له کووېډ-19 څخه روغې وتلې دي، راپور ورکړل شوی دی.
en-mt: Depending on the behavior of other forms of the coronavirus, immunity is likely to change, but there have been reports of cases of people recovering from Covid-19 after testing positive for the coronavirus.

sourceString: These cases are believed to be worsening of a lingering infection rather than re-infection.
targetString: ددغو پېښو په اړه باور دا دی چې د نوي مکروب پر ځای د دوامداره ناروغۍ د بدتر کېدو لامل ګرځي.
en-mt: The belief about these events is that instead of new microbes, they cause the worsening of the persistent disease.

sourceString: The virus is thought to be natural and have an animal origin, through spillover infection.
targetString: د وېروس په اړه باور دا دی چې دا یو طبیعي وېروس دی او د پراخو مکروبونو له لارې له ژوو څخه سرچینه اخلي.
en-mt: The belief about the virus is that it is a natural virus and originates from animals through widespread microbes.

sourceString: The actual origin is unknown, but by December 2019 the spread of infection was almost entirely driven by human-to-human transmission.
targetString: اصلي سرچینه یې نامالومه ده، خو په دسمبر 2019 کې وېروس نږدې په بشپړه توګه له یو انسان څخه بل انسان ته پر خپرېدو پیل وکړ.
en-mt: The original source is unknown, but in December 2019, the virus began to spread almost entirely from person to person.

sourceString: A study of the first 41 cases of confirmed COVID-19, published in January 2020 in The Lancet, revealed the earliest date of onset of symptoms as 1 December 2019.
targetString: د کووېډ-19 تایید شوو 41 پېښو څېړنې، چې په جنوري 2020 کې په لانسیت (The Lancet) کې خپره شوه، وښوده چې د ناروغۍ د علایمو د پیل تر ټولو مخکنۍ نېټه 1 دسمبر 2019 وه.
en-mt: A study of 41 confirmed cases of Covid-19, published in The Lancet in January 2020, showed that the earliest date of onset of symptoms was December 1, 2019.

sourceString: Official publications from the WHO reported the earliest onset of symptoms as 8 December 2019.
targetString: د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان په رسمي خپرونو کې د ناروغۍ د علایمو د پیل تر ټولو مخکنۍ نېټه 8 دسمبر 2019 ښودل شوېده.
en-mt: In the official publications of the World Health Organization, the earliest date of the onset of symptoms of the disease is December 8, 2019.

sourceString: Several measures are commonly used to quantify mortality.
targetString: د مړینو د شمېر ټاکلو لپاره ډېر شمېر اقدامات په مشترک ډول کارول کیږي.
en-mt: A number of measures are commonly used to determine the number of deaths.

sourceString: These numbers vary by region and over time and are influenced by the volume of testing, healthcare system quality, treatment options, time since initial outbreak and population characteristics such as age, sex and overall health.
targetString: دا شمېرې د هرې سیمې پر بنسټ او د وخت په تېرېدو سره توپیر کوي او د معایناتو د حجم، د روغتیایي پاملرنو د سیستم کیفیت، د درملنې غوراویو، د ناروغۍ له پیل راهیسې د وخت، او د خلکو د مشخصاتو، لکه عمر، جنسیت، او ټولې روغتیا تر اغېزې لاندې دی.
en-mt: These numbers vary by region and over time and depend on the volume of examinations, the quality of the health care system, treatment options, time since disease onset, and population characteristics such as age, gender, etc. , and all health is affected.

sourceString: In late 2019, WHO assigned the emergency ICD-10 disease codes U07.1 for deaths from lab-confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection and U07.2 for deaths from clinically or epidemiologically diagnosed COVID-19 without lab-confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection.The death-to-case ratio reflects the number of deaths divided by the number of diagnosed cases within a given time interval.
targetString: د 2019 په وروستیو کې، د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان د ICD-10 ناروغۍ بېړنیو کوډونو څخه کار واخیست. د U07.1 کوډ د هغو مړینو لپاره چې په لابراتوار کې د SARS-CoV-2 وېروس په اخته کېدو سره تایید شوي وو او U07.2 کوډ د هغو مړینو لپاره چې په کلینیکي یا ایپیډیمیولاجیک ډول د SARS-CoV-2 وېروس د لابراتوار له تایید پرته تشخیص شوي وو. د مړینې-تر-پېښې نسبت کې د هغو مړینو شمېر راځي چې په ټاکلي وخت کې د تشخیص شوو قضیو پر شمېر باندې وېشل کیږي.
en-mt: In late 2019, the World Health Organization adopted ICD-10 disease emergency codes. Code U07.1 for deaths with laboratory-confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection and code U07.2 for deaths with clinically or epidemiologically confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection. The diagnosis was made without laboratory confirmation. The death-to-incidence ratio is the number of deaths divided by the number of diagnosed cases in a given period of time.

sourceString: Based on Johns Hopkins University statistics, the global death-to-case ratio is 6.9% (153,822/2,240,191) as of 17 April 2020.
targetString: د جانز هاپکنز پوهنتون احصاییې له مخې، تر 17 اپریل 2020 پورې په نړیواله کچه له مرګ-تر-پېښې نسبت 6.9% دی.
en-mt: According to statistics from Johns Hopkins University, the global death-to-incidence ratio is 6.9% as of April 17, 2020.

sourceString: The number varies by region.Other measures include the case fatality rate (CFR), which reflects the percent of diagnosed individuals who die from a disease, and the infection fatality rate (IFR), which reflects the percent of infected individuals (diagnosed and undiagnosed) who die from a disease.
targetString: شمېرې په هره سیمه کې توپیر کوي. نورو اقداماتو کې د پېښې د مړینې کچه ده چې د هغو تشخیص شوو کسانو فیصدي منعکسوي چې له یوې ناروغۍ څخه مړه شوي وي، او د وېروس د مړینې کچه چې پر ناروغۍ د اخته کسانو (تشخیص شوي او ناتشخیص شوي) فیصدي منعکسوي چې له یوې ناروغۍ څخه مړه شوي وي.
en-mt: The numbers vary from region to region. Other measures are the case fatality rate, which reflects the percentage of diagnosed individuals who die from a disease, and the virus mortality rate, which reflects the percentage of infected individuals (diagnosed and undiagnosed) who die from a disease. died of disease.

sourceString: These statistics are not time bound and follow a specific population from infection through case resolution.
targetString: دا احصاییې د وخت پر اساس نه وي چمتوي او له پېښې د رغېدو له لارې پر ناروغۍ اخته مشخص خلک څاري.
en-mt: These statistics are not prepared on a time basis and track specific people who have contracted the disease through recovery from the incident.

sourceString: While not all infected people develop antibodies, the presence of antibodies may provide information about how many people have been infected.
targetString: په داسې حال کې چې ډېر شمېر ناروغو خلکو کې انټي باډی نه تولیديږي، د انټي باډي شتون ښایي په دې اړه مالومات برابر کړي چې ولې دومره ډېر خلک پر وېروس اخته کېږي.
en-mt: While many sick people do not develop antibodies, the presence of antibodies may provide clues as to why so many people become infected with the virus.

sourceString: In the epicentre of the outbreak in Italy, Castiglione d'Adda, a small village of 4600, 80 (1.7%) are already dead.
targetString: په ایټالیا کې د ناروغۍ د پیل په مرکز کې یو کوچنی کلی، کاستیګلین ډي اډه، چې 4600 خلک پکې اوسیږي، 80 (1.7%) له وړاندې پکې مړه شول.
en-mt: A small village at the epicenter of the outbreak in Italy, Castiglione d'Ada, with a population of 4,600, had 80 (1.7%) deaths.

sourceString: In Gangelt, the disease was spread by Carnival festivals, and spread to younger people, causing a relatively lower mortality, and not all COVID-19 deaths may have been formally classified as such.
targetString: په ګانګلیت کې، ناروغي د کارنیوال فسټیوالونو له کبله خپره شوه، او ځوانې طبقې خلکو ته خپره شوه چې د مړینې کچه یې نسبتا ټیته ده او په داسې ډول د کوويډ-19 پر ناروغۍ د ټولو اخته کسانو مرګ په رسمي ډول ښایي پټ نه وای.
en-mt: In Ganglit, the disease spread because of carnival festivals, and the younger population had a relatively low mortality rate, so that not all deaths from Covid-19 could be officially hidden. .

sourceString: Furthermore, the German health system has not been overwhelmed.
targetString: د دې سربېره، د جرمني روغتیایي سیستم لاتراوسه تر فشار لاندې نه وو راغلی.
en-mt: In addition, the German health system was not yet under pressure.

sourceString: In the Netherlands, about 3% may have antibodies, as assessed from blood donors.
targetString: د وینې د ډونرانو له ارزونې سره، په هالنډ کې ښایي 3% خلکو انټي باډي درلوده.
en-mt: By screening blood donors, about 3% of people in the Netherlands had antibodies.

sourceString: 69 (0.004% of the population) have been confirmed to have died from COVID-19.
targetString: 69 تایید شوي کسان (د ټول نفوس 0.004%) له کووېډ-19 څخه مړه شوي دي.
en-mt: 69 confirmed people (0.004% of the total population) have died from Covid-19.

sourceString: The impact of the pandemic and its mortality rate are different for men and women.
targetString: د وبا اغېزه او د مړینې کچه په ښځو او سړیو کې توپیر لري.
en-mt: Epidemic impact and mortality rates differ between women and men.

sourceString: Mortality is higher in men in studies conducted in China and Italy.
targetString: په چین او ایټالیا کې د څېړنو له مخې د مړینې کچه په سړیو کې ډېره ده.
en-mt: According to studies in China and Italy, the death rate is higher in men.

sourceString: The highest risk for men is in their 50s, with the gap between men and women closing only at 90.
targetString: د سړیو لپاره د هغوی خطر لرونکی عمر 50 کلونه دي، چې د سړيو او ښځو تر منځ تشه یواځې په 90 کلنۍ کې تړل کیږي.
en-mt: For men, their risk age is 50 years, with the gap between men and women closing only at the age of 90.

sourceString: In China, the death rate was 2.8 percent for men and 1.7 percent for women.
targetString: په چین کې د سړیو د مړینې کچه 2.8 سلنه او د ښځو د مړینې کچه 1.7سلنه وه.
en-mt: In China, the male mortality rate was 2.8 percent and the female mortality rate was 1.7 percent.

sourceString: The exact reasons for this sex-difference is not known, but genetic and behavioural factors could be a reason.
targetString: د جنسیت د دغه توپیر اصلي دلیل مالوم نه دی، خو ارثي او کړنیز فکتورونه یې دلیل کېدی شي.
en-mt: The main reason for this gender difference is not known, but genetic and behavioral factors may be the reason.

sourceString: Sex-based immunological differences, lesser prevalence of smoking in women and men developing co-morbid conditions such as hypertension at a younger age than women could have contributed to the higher mortality in men.
targetString: د جنسیت پر بنسټ ولاړ ایمیونولوجیک توپیرونه، چې په ښځو کې یې خپوروالی تر سړیو کم دی او په سړیو کې د ښځو په پرتله په یو وخت کې د څو ناروغیو شتون لکه په ځوانۍ کې لوړ فشار د هغوی په مړینه کې د ډېروالي لامل کېدی شي.
en-mt: Sex-based immunological differences, with a lower prevalence in women than men, and the co-occurrence of multiple diseases in men compared to women, such as hypertension in adolescence, may contribute to increased mortality. .

sourceString: In Europe, 57% of the infected individuals were men and 72% of those died with COVID-19 were men.
targetString: په اروپا کې 57% اخته کسان سړي وو او 72% هغه کسان چې له کووېډ-19 څخه مړه شوي، سړي وو.
en-mt: In Europe, 57% of infected people were men and 72% of those who died from Covid-19 were men.

sourceString: As of April 2020, the US government is not tracking sex-related data of COVID-19 infections.
targetString: تر اپرېل 2020 پورې، د امریکا متحده ایالتو حکومت د کووېډ-19 ناروغیو د جنسیت اړونده ډېټا نه څارله.
en-mt: As of April 2020, the United States government did not track gender-specific data on COVID-19 infections.

sourceString: Research has shown that viral illnesses like Ebola, HIV, influenza and SARS affect men and women differently.
targetString: څېړنو ښودلې چې د ایبولا، ایچ ای وي، انفلووینزا او SARS ویروسي ناروغۍ سړي او ښځې په جلا ډول اغېزمن کړي.
en-mt: Studies have shown that Ebola, HIV, influenza and SARS viral diseases affect men and women differently.

sourceString: A higher percentage of health workers, particularly nurses, are women, and they have a higher chance of being exposed to the virus.
targetString: د روغتیایي کارکوونکو لوړه سلنه، په ځانګړې توګه نرسان، ښځې جوړوي، او دوی پر وېروس د اخته کېدو چانس ډېر دی.
en-mt: A high percentage of healthcare workers, especially nurses, are women, and they are more likely to contract the virus.

sourceString: The World Health Organization announced on 11 February 2020 that the official name of the disease would be "COVID-19".
targetString: د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان په 11 فبروری 2020 کې اعلان کړه چې د ناروغۍ رسمي نوم باید "کووېډ-19" وي.
en-mt: The World Health Organization announced on 11 February 2020 that the official name of the disease should be "Covid-19".

sourceString: WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus explained that CO stands for corona, VI for virus, D for disease, and 19 for when the outbreak was first identified: 31 December 2019.
targetString: د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان مشر، ټیډروس ادانوم ګیبریاسوس څرګنده کړه چې په دې نوم کې CO د کورونا، VI د وېروس، D د ناروغۍ او 19 د هغه وخت لپاره راځي چې ناروغي په لومړي ځل پکې پیل او وپېژندل شوه: 31 دسمبر 2019.
en-mt: The head of the World Health Organization, Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, explained that in this name CO stands for Corona, VI for the virus, D for the disease and 19 for the time when the disease first started and was recognized: 31 December 2019.

sourceString: The name had been chosen to avoid references to a specific geographical location (e.g. China), animal species or group of people, in line with international recommendations for naming aimed at preventing stigmatisation.The virus that causes COVID-19 is named severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: دا نوم یوې ځانګړې جغرافیې (لکه چین)، ژوو، یا د خلکو یوې ډلې ته د راجع کولو څخه د ډډې کولو په موخه وټاکل شو. دا نوم له نړیوالو سپارښتنو سره سم وټاکل شو چې موخه یې د بدنامولو مخنیوی دی. وېروس چې کوويد-19 رامنځته کوي د حاد تنفسي ناروغۍ علایمو لرونکی کوروناوېروس 2 یا SARS-CoV-2 په نوم یادیږي.
